content: if you want to avoid the fee you ll have to select another showing but if you stick with the high demand showtime whatever credit card you have on file with moviepass will be charged tapping on the peak pricing showtime will display what the added fee is but the amount will depend on the movie the time and the level of popularity after selecting a showtime in peak pricing the app will take you to a confirmation screen that show the detail of the added charge in the coming week moviepass say it will begin offering a peak pas that will let user waive one peak pricing fee per month customer with an annual pas won t be subject to peak pricing until their subscription renews the new peak pricing feature is aimed at providing additional flexibility for u and our user around popular movie and time for which there is limited inventory moviepass website say we are building peak pricing to be flexible and will be able to tweak it a needed based on the community s response the company also take aim at amc s new subscription offer saying the theater chain s plan mean you pay more for way fewer option along with amc moviepass is also facing competition from sinemia and other chain like alamo drafthouse while it continues to deal with it money trouble peak pricing will roll out to all region over the next few week image moviepass
title: MoviePass’ surge pricing starts today

content: the watchlist is now bundled into the my stuff tab and hovering over the thumbnail for a show or movie offer the option to play it remove it from view or add it to my stuff to check out later click on a title and an information card pop up over the homepage without navigating to a separate link once a video start playing button along the bottom allow user to skip ahead or backward  second at a time and clicking up next in the bottom right hand corner play the following episode in a series this design is an evolution of the format the company rolled out a year ago for it hulu with live tv subscriber the web version of hulu ha a handful of exclusive feature including picture in picture chromecast option and the ability to watch multiple sport game in multiple window for live tv subscriber
title: Hulu’s website looks different today

content: tumblr s ban on adult content is now in effect and user will begin to see explicit post disappear from public view medium showing sex act exposed genitals and female presenting nipple will be hidden all post that are currently flagged a explicit are now being hidden from view according to tumblr and that includes post that user are in the process of appealing in addition to what s already gone more adult content is going to be flagged in coming week tumblr say and it hope that the automated tool will be more accurate at picking out what count a explicit tumblr announced the ban on december rd to immediate backlash user began to mourn the site s diverse sex positive community and massive archive of explicit content some began to share a guide posted to github for exporting tumblr blog on window while others wrote eulogy for the site tumblr is acknowledging user reaction while not changing the policy in a blog post that went up today tumblr apologized to user we are sorry that this ha not been an easy transition and we know we can do a better job of explaining what we re doing it said the change would be a slow process that involves flagging ten of billion of gifs video and photo many user also criticized tumblr s decision to consider female presenting nipple a explicit while male presenting nipple were still okay some pointed out that in the case of non binary genderfluid or trans individual it would be confusing where the line would be drawn on whose nipple would be considered explicit in it blog post today tumblr ha added the caveat yeah we know you hate this term but maintained the language and distinction after tumblr initially announced the ban user immediately began to see innocuous post of turtle dog and doll all flagged a explicit photo containing a bit of skin in leather tights or cleavage such a in a fashion week show were also flagged despite not fitting tumblr s definition of adult content whether these post are hidden from view today depends on whether user appeal were processed in time we understand and agree that there have been too many wrongfully flagged post since we announced the policy change say tumblr but if user don t appeal their post then they re out of luck that could also be a problem for popular older account which may not have anyone monitoring them to appeal the overly aggressive moderation flagged content will be hidden but not deleted tumblr emphasized that will allow post to be appealed even after they re removed from public view this is explicit content will somebody think of the child tumblr pic twitter com wqwcqfgb emily animator illustrator edanimation december   tumblr say that it automated tool are getting smarter over time so even if this cute photo of a dog is censored for now eventually the tool should learn better it also reassures blogger that all appeal will be sent to a real live human who can make the appropriate call more clarity wa given on tumblr s nipple ban with tumblr saying nipple would be allowed in depiction of gender confirmation surgery breastfeeding post mastectomy surgery and other health related situation nudity in politics sculpture and illustration are likewise allowed but user will still need to appeal if their post are misclassified or they ll remain hidden
title: Tumblr porn vanishes today

content: headed to the airport this morning you might want to double check and even triple check your flight departure time before settling at the gate today major airline including american delta jetblue southwest and united airline are reporting system wide operating issue causing delay a long a two hour for some passenger stranded on the tarmac last weekend some  passenger on a united flight headed to hong kong from newark new jersey read more read in a tweet american airline said the issue involved an aerodata outage software that measure weight and balance so that a flight can depart safely southwest however ha said that issue have since been resolved and delta confirmed that data is now operating normally with no cancellation planned still in response to the news the faa ha tweeted that passenger should contact their airline directly for flight information and any necessary update and one airport in florida reported a many a  delay this morning alone what should you do before making your way to the airport call your airline and download your airline app for any update a soon a possible checking twitter for your airport isnt such a bad idea eitheryou might come across some angry flier with helpful information for more from lifehacker be sure to follow u on instagram lifehackerdotcom
title: Check For Flight Delays Before Flying Today

content: it might be the most monday mondayiest monday of the year after a long turkey fueled holiday weekend you now find yourself back at work dreaming of your pajama and a bowl of mashed potato rather than your black friday discounted suit and stale coffee so start small today there no need to conquer your entire to do list rather focus on one attainable goalfinishing up the company newsletter prepping for a presentation scheduling year end doctor appointmentsand get that done we all want to establish good habit and break bad one but most of u approach the process all read more read break it down into microtasks if you need to and check one off at a time read the new york time smarter living newsletter if you just cant motivate yourself to get started on something today slice it up into the smallest possible unit of progress and attack them one at a time stop obsessing over what youre going to write in the email you just cant bring yourself to write and instead just click the button to open up a new email type in the recipient address click the subject line window write a subject line and so on forgive yourself and your coworkers if youre a bit sluggish and put one foot in front of the other and so on after your task is complete draw up your list for the rest of the week it only monday after all there plenty of time to get everything done
title: Focus on Accomplishing One Task Today

content: i m a big instapaper hoarder i once racked up an unread list of over  article essay story and other short form piece plus a couple novel in that app i wa never going to read everything i d saved it wa time to clean out my instapaper and if you have a clogged reading list on your instapaper your pocket or your evernote it s time to clean out yours too like any to do list a reading list often represents outsized aspiration when you save a story you re imagining yourself a the person who s read that story a person who understands bitcoin a person with opinion on lady bird a person who s been emotionally moved by cat person but we can t always be all these people for example no one will ever understand bitcoin we re all very busy and every day there are more article published online than one person could read in a lifetime if you hope to read what s really important you need to narrow your definition of important here are three strategy for trimming your list strategy  the marie kondo method in the life changing magic of tidying up marie kondo recommends holding each of your possession against your chest and asking doe this spark joy you can try the same with your reading list will i enjoy reading this don t think about how it feel to have read the article it always feel good to have read something what matter is how it feel to read it and enjoy doesn t have to mean feel happy you can enjoy reading a grueling piece about war or depression by learning from it or soaking in whatever strong emotion other than boredom you can enjoy required reading by feeling prepared for your meeting or midterm if that feel too abstract ask this instead can i get away with not reading this article is the relevant news cycle already over will someone publish a simpler recap of this piece later will someone publish a deeper dive in any of these case archive that article one last question to ask yourself why did i save this if you don t recall and the article doesn t sound particularly fascinating ditch it there are some thing you really do have to read thing for work for school for your friend who asks you every day whether you ve read their novel but if all you feel is some vague sense that everyone is supposed to read this i m giving you permission right now to archive that sucker when people ask if you read it say sorry i wa busy when people argue about the article don t join them you might feel left out but is that really worse than plodding through that boring article probably not i love book i can t leave a bookstore without at least one but i also have a tendency to buy read more read strategy  the speed read at the start of one typical reading session your commute your lunch break your kid nap check how many piece are in your reading list then guess how many of them you could skim through just to get the gist before your session is over now try to beat that guess you might get bogged down in actually reading one of the article that s not terrible it s kind of the goal of this whole exercise but if you notice yourself doing it hold onto that article for later it passed the test and find something more skimmable i ve been both a student and an instructor and i totally get it textbook are dry and hard to read more read strategy  the great sort if you re too timid for the method above but you still feel anxious over your pile of unreads make a long term folder any time you re reading an article and you re tempted to switch to another or even to twitter move that article to the long term folder if you have a few old article at the top of your list that you always scroll past move them to the long term folder everything you re at all tepid about move it to that folder then you can read all the fun stuff in the home folder your inbox folder before moving back to the long term folder and digging through that a you please it s possible that you ll never get around to opening that long term folder if so that s great you were probably never going to read those piece anyway which is fine but they re still there if you change your mind maintaining sanity i don t believe marie kondo s promise that if you clean out your home once you ll never fill it with junk again you re not going to magically stop saving boring article but you can get better at archiving them sort your article oldest to newest and don t let yourself skip past article if you keep skipping one archive it to stay aware of your backlog enable the unread item badge on your reading app whenever that count get too high do a skim session test different method and pick whatever work for you but whatever method you use remember no one read everything and no one should
title: Clean Out Your Instapaper Reading List Today

content: a you go through your afternoon email look at the rest of your inbox maybe you have some old email in there email from  email from  the longer you took to respond the more you got scared and now you keep them in your inbox for what to guilt yourself to ruin your morning today s the day you fix this today is the fourth annual email debt forgiveness day the day that everyone is encouraged to send long overdue email without even mentioning how long it s been even a simple sorry for the delay is optional instead you can just throw in that link above which explains the concept the host of reply all a podcast about the internet invented edf day in  and have celebrated it every year since encouraging people to answer old email a simply and guilt free a possible because perfect is the enemy of done today is also a good day to archive email that you will never reply to if something s been sitting in your inbox for over a year now is the time to let it go archive delete lay down your burden year before email debt forgiveness there wa email bankruptcy this work best with email thread where the other person never followed up where you don t know if they d actually care at this point or where you actually hate interacting with the other person save them the trouble of forming their own response hit archive and let the whole affair drift silently into the past whether you re declaring email bankruptcy or laundry bankruptcy sometimes the only way to read more read we ve always been big fan of letting go of old goal a a healthy part of productivity while some people give up too easily ambitious and accomplished people often err in the other direction holding on too tightly to every good intention so much that they get le done it s crucial to get realistic and clean out the le important task i have a bad to do habit i make big ambitious list of thing i want to do then let them pile up read more read but that also mean that sometimes it s ok to do a half assed job again it s better than nothing and today you have official permission from reply all and from lifehacker don t stress over a full screen reply full of apology and catch ups just reply with two line here s how a if only a few minute had passed see where that take you
title: Today Is Email Debt Forgiveness Day

content: remember when we told you to enroll for health insurance by december  that s today if you live in ca ny ma wa mn co ri ct md or dc you get a few extra day or week but for the other  state last call is today the open enrollment period on healthcare gov end december  and the current administration is read more read this deadline applies to people who don t get insurance through their employer but who buy it themselves from healthcare gov or one of it state run equivalent even if insurance wa expensive last year or if you didn t qualify for subsidy check again thing have changed  percent of enrollee will be able to find something for   month or le for more on how to sign up and what you ll need to know check out our guide here and refer to healthcare gov or your state s marketplace believe it or not the affordable care act is still in effect most people who don t have coverage read more read
title: ACA Enrollment Ends Today in Most States

content: it s a humbling experience to have people digging out your life in front of you said curtis skene the owner of the house who narrowly escaped the mudflows by taking shelter behind an olive tree in his garden i m humbled and grateful photo oprah winfrey visited with her neighbor curtis skene a volunteer helped dig out his home in montecito credit jim wilson the new york time a day later oprah winfrey came to document the dig out with a camera crew in a community filled with celebrity her estate is one street over the bucket brigade ha dug out both mansion and modest bungalow they are also trying to save oak tree from suffocation among the digger is carol bartoli  a chef and caterer who ha outlasted some of the younger volunteer after the mudslide the attitude wa if the mud is on your property it s your responsibility she said i just thought i m going to help with the rainy season all but over the group work under bright blue sky but in the hill above montecito boulder are perched precariously a if waiting for their cue to tumble if you live between the mountain and the ocean it s almost par for the course said josiah hamilton a real estate agent and a leader of the bucket brigade it s something you have to be prepared for california online please note we regularly highlight article on news site that have limited access for nonsubscribers photo credit in march up   percent from february and up   percent from a year ago it s no surprise that tech job are helping push up the price the median annual pay at facebook is    san francisco chronicle photo queensway bay in long beach calif with the queen mary and dock in the distance a   million entertainment and hotel complex is planned for the waterfront next to the queen mary credit jake michael for the new york time long beach ha long struggled to revive it downtown now three dozen project are underway or in the pipeline in one of the country s largest downtown redevelopment the new york time gavin newsom the front runner in the governor s race admitted to a drinking problem a decade ago now he say alcohol isn t a problem a little wine is fine san francisco chronicle california s state government is flush with cash the state s income tax revenue ha continued to far exceed both projection and last year s total in the current fiscal year tax have totaled over   billion nearly  billion ahead of projection and over  billion ahead of this point last year san francisco chronicle in the latest blow to local journalism in california the sacramento bee laid off  journalist on tuesday sacramento business journal oakland is struggling to attract woman and underrepresented minority into it police academy the city s th police academy will add a many a  new officer to the city s street when it wrap up in july but there won t be any woman or african american in the graduating class the attrition rate for woman in the last three police academy wa  percent compared with  percent for men east bay express a latino activist organization hermandad mexicana on tuesday announced a statewide campaign of noncooperation with all police authority orange county register a developer want to build a  unit housing complex in berkeley native american group say the site wa once part of an ohlone settlement that included large mound of seashell that may have also been a burial ground berkeleyside and finally photo katherine morrow with the portrait of her mother that wa rescued from the detritus of the montecito mudslide credit jim wilson the new york time in her late  katherine morrow turned to a life of meditation she whittled down her possession and rented a small bungalow by a creek in montecito but after mud crashed through the house in january blowing the front door off it hinge there wa one item she hoped to retrieve a portrait of her late mother drawn by a canadian artist frederick varley four day after the mudslide she returned with a sheriff s deputy wading through thigh deep mud that wa a sticky a peanut butter among tree root and shard of glass m morrow spotted the corner of the picture frame she slipped it out of the muck and brought it to a shop in santa barbara that specializes in restoring damaged art a woman working at the shop entered the piece into the computer a mother the frame looked like a mud sandwich the restorer said m morrow ha now put her possession into  small box and is contemplating her next move she keep the image of her mother pressed in between sheet of packing foam she wa a very good mother very nurturing m morrow said california today go live at  a m pacific time weekday tell u what you want to see catoday nytimes com california today is edited by julie bloom who grew up in los angeles and graduated from u c berkeley continue reading the main story

content: secondly you ll now have access to the new xbox avatar which include a wide range of body type and new accessory and appearance item like makeup nose ring and fingernail the new avatar editor also let you control the color of pretty much every aspect of your avatar of course if you d rather stick with your original avatar you can do that too the update also brings dolby vision hdr streaming support to xbox one s and xbox one x to enable head to setting display and sound video output video mode and then allow dolby vision additionally xbox ha added five more language to narrator on xbox one including spanish portuguese polish swedish and dutch a well a an australian version of english lastly microsoft and amazon are teaming up on a promotion if you buy a qualified xbox one s or xbox one x bundle through the online retailer you ll get a free echo dot microsoft say that this promotion will only be available while supply last and will launch in the coming day
title: Microsoft is rolling out Xbox Avatars today

content: the channel launched in december  and wa nintendo s first big foray into a digital medium download service on it console it reflected nintendo s perpetual caution around online feature hence the wii point system but it also freed you from having to buy physical copy at a time when that wa still a novelty for many gamers how many wii owner remember downloading their first wiiware title or virtual console flashback it even became a bit of a cultural phenomenon there s a good chance you remember the wii shop channel s synth laden bossa nova soundtrack by heart you probably won t wax nostalgic for too long if you own a wii u or switch the channel s successor the eshop is clearly an improvement with direct purchase and a catalog that includes more of the game you see in retail store even so we wouldn t blame you for shedding a few tear while the wii enjoyed one of the longest run in console history you can still buy new game for it it s that much closer to fading away
title: Nintendo's Wii Shop Channel shuts down today

content: echo dot the revamped echo dot ha a new look with rounded edge and pack more punch with a   inch driver delivering  percent louder audio than the previous model amazon say the speaker ha lower distortion and enhanced bass of course it can connect to other speaker and other apps and device over bluetooth amazon claim echo dot is the best selling speaker ever and will hope to continue it success when the latest version ship in october you can pre order one for the same   price a the last model echo sub if you re craving more low end tone from your echo setup you might consider the echo sub it delivers down firing w of bass through it  inch woofer and you can pair it with an echo or two to create a   stereo system echo sub will set you back   or you can bundle it with a pair of echo speaker and pre order are open now echo plus amazon updated it echo plus which includes a smart hub for a range of connected device this time around it ha revamped speaker and a feature called local voice control which let you adjust your various smart home device even if your internet connection is down there s a temperature sensor too so echo plus can tell smart thermostat to turn up the heat when it get a little chilly you can pre order one now for   and it start shipping in october echo input not to be outdone by chromecast audio amazon ha it own audio dongle called echo input including bluetooth a microphone and a  mm jack it doesn t have a speaker so you ll need to connect it to your existing audio setup it s a way to add alexa connectivity to audio gear you may already own it cost   and pre order are open but it ship later in the year echo link and echo link amp new arrival to the echo lineup this year echo link amp and echo link are for those who are more particular than most about audio quality the former includes a w two channel amplifier with digital and analog connector echo link meanwhile connects to your audio setup to stream high fidelity music that cost   and ship later this year while echo link amp which amazon will release in early  cost   echo show amazon s smart display received an overhaul a the company beefed up echo show with a  inch display alongside more powerful speaker and mics it ha web browser firefox and amazon s silk this time around along with skype video chat support and vevo music video it ship next month with the same   price tag again pre order are open now fire tv recast amazon is dipping into the dvr game this year with fire tv recast it work with over the air network using an antenna and will send live tv or recorded show to fire tablet fire tv echo show or mobile device and of course you can use alexa to control it the   version ha a pair of tuner that let you record two show at the same time and enough storage space  gb for around  hour of hd tv the   model double the tuner simultaneous show recording and storage space you can pre order them now and they ll ship in november echo auto it probably shouldn t come a a surprise that amazon want to put alexa in your car even if you don t have a fancy dashboard infotainment system enter echo auto it s a dongle that connects to your audio system and us phone s cell connection since you need internet access for alexa to work along with the conversational assistance you d expect with alexa you can use echo auto for direction echo auto isn t quite ready to hit amazon s storefront yet when it doe it ll cost   though you can request an invite to use the pre release model later this year which will be half the price smart plug amazon ha found a way to connect alexa to pretty much any wall powered device using it smart plug once you ve linked them to an echo or the alexa app you can turn device on and off or set timer smart plug cost   each pre order are open and they ll ship in october amazonbasics microwave so about that microwave like the smart plug you ll need to use another echo device or the alexa app to control the amazonbasics microwave with your voice it ha a number of voice presets to help you cook food quickly the best part if you run out of popcorn you can automatically order more in a pinch with amazon s dash feature you can pre order one now for   before shipment start later in the year echo wall clock for   you can pick up an echo wall clock which strangely enough ha alexa connectivity again you ll need to use an echo speaker or the alexa app to bark command at it it give you a visual display of any timer you have in place using led minute marker and a countdown for the last  second the clock update to the correct time automatically and it will ship later this year follow all the latest news from amazon s alexa event here
title: Here's every Alexa device Amazon announced today

content: in sacramento the former governor and occasional actor broke with national republican at least of today when he championed environmental protection effort including stringent emission control in sentiment also reflected by mr kasich and mr mayes mr schwarzenegger said the republican party had to be environmentally progressive socially liberal and fiscally conservative in order to be competitive our party is giving them twitter fight instead of answer mr schwarzenegger said and it is sinking u it is time to return to the issue the politics of division and anger and resentment can deleting their account i think it s a clear signal that this is a major trust issue for people and i understand that and whether people delete their app over it or just don t feel good about using outside boston the new york time and finally the time reporter david streitfeld had an article wednesday on facebook s plan to build a community with housing and retail in it hometown menlo park in silicon valley but if reader comment are any indication the project face an uphill battle to acceptance many commenters referenced the escalating crisis over cambridge analytica and the company s lax approach to privacy a reason enough to stay away facebook might have two billion user but many are wary of living in facebookland that sound great a whole city full of ready player one arrogant nerd closing rank against reality we can measure their success by the zeroed out birthrate and the truckloads of amazon box full of inflatable companionship much like smart speaker this new model community is a faustian bargain where you sacrifice your personal privacy and private data right in exchange for high end centrally located convenience all too willingly provided by a company whose sole intent is to monetize the detail of your daily life by auctioning off your information to the highest bidder but a few reader celebrated the efficiency of big tech i ve been much more pleased with my dealing with facebook and google and apple and amazon than any city county or state government i ve gotten extreme value from tech while i ve mostly got waste incompetence and corruption from government california today go live at  a m pacific time weekday tell u what you want to see catoday nytimes com california today is edited by julie bloom who grew up in los angeles and graduated from u c berkeley continue reading the main story

content: those affected by the smell say it is much more potent than the pot cloud above a grateful dead concert or the medicinal smell of a cannabis dispensary in the case of the uppal family the cannabis wa being grown in greenhouse nestled in the vineyard several hundred foot away one member of the uppal family with muscular dystrophy jiwan had trouble breathing and wa admitted to the intensive care unit of a hospital the smell wa so bad we couldnt even go outside m uppal said the smell stretched to the nearby old adobe elementary charter school where child playing outside asked what the odor wa according to the school principal jeff williamson some parent were really upset about it mr williamson said with three other family in the neighborhood the uppals sued the pot grower carlos zambrano who wa found to be operating without a license according to the uppals lawyer kevin block the uppals and their neighbor sued in federal court under the rico act the decade old law designed to prosecute organized crime to stop the cannabis operation and recover    they paid in legal fee so far the court will hear a motion to dismiss the case on thursday
title: California Today: California Today: What’s That Smell?

content: sean parker the former president of facebook hadnt heard of the california coastal commission when it regulator found that his planned high dollar wedding had involved building in a redwood grove without permission in  but mr parker ended up giving the agency which is tasked with protecting public access to the state beach a big boost in addition to paying fine he agreed to build an app mapping more than   beach access point the los angeles time reported last week the commission unveiled the result the yourcoast app now instead of rolling the dice when you head toward the ocean not knowing whether that tiny beach your friend told you about ha a bathroom or parking you can now check an app of course regulator were happy to tout the unique collaboration this is an only in california story the commission chairwoman dayna bochco said california today go live at   a m pacific time weekday tell u what you want to see catoday nytimes com california today is edited by julie bloom who grew up in los angeles and graduated from u c berkeley

content: it depends on what your first language is it s easier for an adult to learn another language that come from the same language family a one s first language mr liu explained how can adult learner practice a second language outside the classroom find way to immerse yourself in the language said elizabeth zackheim chief executive of abc language a language learning center in midtown next time you visit a country where the language is spoken sign up for a course at a local language school or hire a tutor to work with you daily for a couple of hour m zackheim advised the most important thing is to get out there and use your language a much a possible and have fun with it she added success happens every day you show up for class or create a moment of connection in your foreign language speaking correctly is nice but you don t have to be perfect to make a moment happen if you re considering learning another language look no further than our backyard a few option in new york independent school like abc language in midtown or bell language in midwood brooklyn and free course online learning platform or conversation group in english and other language at various branch of the new york public library the brooklyn public library and the queen library system esto e lo que est sucediendo here s what else is happening

content: good morning want to get california today by email here the sign up will los angeles public school teacher go on strike it ha been nearly two month since the city teacher union overwhelmingly voted in favor of one since then district official and the union united teacher los angeles had three negotiating session with a state mediator and are not any closer to an agreement than when they began now with the failed mediation behind them they are in the midst of independent fact finding which will give an analysis of the financial state of the district school official all over the district are readying for what many believe is an inevitable strike this week sending parent a guide to prepare under state law the union cannot strike until after the financial analysis is completed a process that will last several week but union leader have repeatedly said that the contract talk which have already gone on for  month and stalled again in july have dramatically disintegrated alex caputo pearl the union president seems ready to call for the first teacher strike in los angeles in nearly  year union official have been particularly incensed in the month since austin beutner a former investment banker took over a superintendent mr beutner and member of the school board say that the district would go broke if it accepted what the union called it last best and final offer

content: the problem is that we still have folk who refuse to get their child vaccinated dr barbot said and that ha consequence five of the infected were unvaccinated and one wa too young to have been vaccinated in new york city dr barbot added nearly  percent of school aged child are vaccinated how contagious are the measles highly typically it is transmitted by airborne particle droplet or direct contact dr barbot said so it could be transmitted a easily a you being in a room with someone who ha measles and being close to them but not having to touch them what are the symptom dr barbot said that measles usually present with a viral illness type of condition where an individual can have a cough runny eye fever and then the typical rash that start at the head and then progress downward and also includes the palm and the sole it can last several day the reason why were so concerned she said is because there can be health consequence including thing like pneumonia and thing like inflammation of the tissue and the brain

content: good morning on this damp monday now that fall weather is upon u here are some thing were excited about cooler subway platform halloween movie marathon and a new season for the art we asked our culture critic and writer at the time for their best pick this season and here what they said theater ben brantley the times co chief theater critic recommended two show coming from london the ferryman is a sprawling energy packed cornucopia of a drama he told u set in a rural irish homestead haunted by ghost of crime past during the trouble the jungle mr brantley said provides an immersive tour through the fabled divisive refugee camp in calais both play are bursting with a sense of unquenchable present tense life he said the subject are tragic yet you leave these show fully energized comedy sopan deb who writes about comedy for the time recommended the play that go wrong on broadway ive seen it multiple time and my stomach hurt each time from laughing so hard it quite literally a play that go wrong set piece fall off actor forget their line and the lighting designer fall asleep mr deb also said the two man improv show trike at the magnet theater is one of the best in the city dance marina harss who writes about dance for the time recommends voice of my city at the new york public library for the performing art the exhibition explores the work of the choreographer jerome robbins who did so much to imprint an idea of new york rough edged and electric in work like fancy free and west side story m harss said she also recommended judson dance theater the work is never done at the moma this event attempt to capture the moment choreographer dancer composer and visual artist began to ask themselves what is dance really the show includes dance performance twice a day
title: New York Today: New York Today: Fall Culture Preview

content: she call that chalking back after christine blasey ford and judge brett m kavanaugh testified before the senate judiciary committee in response to dr blaseys sexual assault allegation against judge kavanaugh m sandberg said she had been receiving up to  new message a day many of them about harassment in school before that she would receive fewer than five it been blowing up because what happened with kavanaugh and ford wa back in high school whether this is verbal harassment boy making comment about girl body or physical harassment said m sandberg who ha been adding the hashtag stopharassmentinschools to catcall submitted by student one example the teacher said it your fault wear something appropriate next time emily may the executive director and a co founder of hollaback a global anti street harassment group based in brooklyn said the organization saw a  percent increase in story of harassment shared through it site and app after the  election in term of the current situation in the supreme court she added what i have seen broadly is there being a lot of folk who are having flashback and being re traumatized by the hearing and by the allegation and that translates into a shift of the experience of harassment if youre having flashback and are traumatized by your sexual assault your experience of being degraded and sexualized on the street can hit even harder the majority of those who write to m sandberg are female many of them young girl but she ha also heard from member of the l g b t q community and men who have been harassed because of their gender identity expression or sexuality

content: there are plenty of way to commemorate the occasion from a shamanic winter solstice ceremony in long island city to a silent yoga celebration in of course williamsburg to a concert channeling the greater symphony of the earth at the cathedral of st john the divine for some this time of year is a real challenge thanks to seasonal affective disorder family stress and other trigger to get some timely health tip i called a few mental health expert who did not call back then i called nick bardsley a national academy of sport medicine certified personal trainer precision nutrition coach golf enthusiast and the most physically fit person i know please dont put that he said his advice eat salad broth based soup and ignore detox plan people love the idea of a quick fix or a reset with the new year coming he said it just a massive marketing scam or a my editor andy newman would say avoid extreme solution still the coming of darkness carry with it the temptation to stuff oneself like a bear think about upcoming party or vacation and how you want to look and feel at them mr bardsley advised that may curb your impulse to have extra helping of sweet and treat

content: here s what the law mean for new yorkers will there be fewer ride share vehicle no the number of vehicle in the city will be capped at it current level around   the new law limit new ride share vehicle for a year a the city study the environmental and economic impact of ride sharing service yesterday wa the last day that a driver could register a vehicle with a ride hailing service although the law allows company to add wheelchair accessible vehicle what will change for rider the mayor s office said that rider should not see a change in service and should not notice any significant increase in wait time the mayor s office also doesn t expect to see a significant increase in fare uber however argues that the cap will mean fewer car for passenger who want them especially in the borough outside manhattan we re worried the impact will be felt the most in area not well served by mass transit and where taxi refuse to travel said jason post director of public affair for uber mr post said price for uber rider would not rise immediately but could go up in the future what doe it mean for driver aside from capping the number of vehicle the package of bill signed yesterday also raised the minimum wage of driver to    after expense the new minimum wage would bump driver s income by about  percent on average many yellow cab and uber driver support the cap and say they hope that the new law will translate into le competition more customer and higher income what s next after a year the new york city taxi and limousine commission will be allowed to regulate the number of for hire vehicle on the road presently up to  percent of ride sharing vehicle are unoccupied at any given time according to a study commissioned by the t l c those empty car add to the street congestion and increase competition among driver the city is considering establishing an occupancy rate that is healthier for the city said a spokesman for the mayor s office if successful the law could become a model for other city or state that want to regulate the industry
title: New York Today: New York Today: Capping Uber

content: expert also worry that not enough attention is given to all the way people have made the problem of wildfire worse population growth in california mean there are more people on the road car are a prime culprit in wildfire and more home built in wilderness area it would be easy to throw our hand in the air and say it s just climate change and we can t do anything about it said jennifer k balch a professor of geography at the university of colorado at boulder and an expert on wildfire but actually we are starting the majority of wildfire and we can do something about it another factor many expert say are policy in california that protect forest from timber harvesting and a reluctance to set off controlled fire to burn vegetation william stewart an expert on forestry at the university of california at berkeley said that part of the california dream wa keeping nature a it is with minimal management of forest with so many fire burning so often stephen pyne a fire historian at arizona state university worry the public ha become accustomed to disaster unwilling to have difficult conversation about where house are being built and whether controlled burn are a good idea
title: California Today: California Today: The Human Element in California’s Wildfires

content: what are some of the sign that a colleague is hitting a breaking point the sign are usually emotional you can see people get angry short and start to resent the people who don t work a hard m lechner said another telltale sign sloppiness but it s important to understand what messy work mean she added people who become overburdened and therefore become sloppy are usually your best employee weak employee drop off the bus quickly the best employee are the people who get assigned more and more work an overburdened employee is a reflection of bad management what are the best way to personally prevent a breaking point avoidance and engagement avoid being on the grid   m lechner said carve out for yourself the three or four hour that you need every day to get off the grid and relax and teach the rest of the world a well a yourself that not all hour are email hour and engage more effectively learn to collaborate better when you learn the skill of collaboration or working together the work naturally get distributed more effectively she said how can i help a struggling colleague talk listen and lend a hand get the person to talk corporate life is very taxing and doesn t usually come with a safe space m lechner said people are afraid to talk because they cannot afford to show their weakness because there are some people who are going to take advantage of that getting the person to talk is the first step to isolating the problem listen when you are talking to someone who is overburdened become a sounding board for what need to be renegotiated she added it give the other person the space to think about the boundary of the work that wa assigned and what can be renegotiated maybe they need more time or more resource listen and help them find out
title: New York Today: New York Today: Avoiding a Workplace Breakdown

content: good morning on this boiling tuesday broadway theater will dim their light on thursday to honor neil simon one of the most successful playwright of our time mr simon died on sunday in manhattan he wa  read his obituary here at the height of his work between  and  mr simon s show were performed on new york stage more than   time he produced nearly  play throughout his career but it wa more than mr simon s achievement on broadway that made him a true new yorker he wa born in the bronx in  before moving to washington height a a toddler family struggle during mr simon s childhood his parent constantly fighting and his father in and out of the picture would later inspire his autobiographical comedy lost in yonkers which won a tony award for best play and the pulitzer prize mr simon graduated from dewitt clinton high school in the bronx and attended new york university after his service in the air force air reserve mr simon started his career a a clerk at warner bros where he and his older brother danny began writing script and comedy sketch together

content: nearly  year after it  debut the film nosferatu is according to one of our film critic among the scariest vampire movie ever made another called it simply one of cinema most beautiful horror movie even nonmovie buff may have seen one notable scene from the film a terrified woman sitting on her bed convulses into submission after the shadow of a hand seizes into a fist over her heart like many silent classic nosferatu is sometimes screened with live music accompaniment that usually happens around halloween but if you cant wait that long for such an experience youre in luck the movie is showing for free at brookfield place in lower manhattan thursday at   p m a live score will be performed by the irish composer irene and linda buckley it part of brookfields silent film live music series held inside it indoor market on friday it showing josef von sternbergs  classic crime drama underworld music will be performed by the alloy orchestra a trio of musician dedicated to bringing sound to silent movie

content: the black comixexpo is sunday at the brooklyn academy of music comic book and graphic novel wont be the only thing on display there will also be a virtual reality experience set in the future here how one of it creator ash baccus clark described the experience so you go in and you think youre going to get hair braided but youre really going to get your brain optimized inside the experience the year is  you are not yourself but rather a character a black woman who is a senior in high school inside the futuristic hair salon is a second character whom m baccus clark described a a black female version of dr frankenstein a brilliant scientist whose creation ha gone awry and is feverishly trying to set thing right m baccus clark a trained molecular biologist is having some fun you cant build a virtual world inside a neurocosmetology lab without a sense of humor right but underneath all that world building is some very serious work m baccus clark and her colleague are using a version of this exhibition to collect data about perception and bias we want to see whether or not embodying our audience in the body of a black avatar and showing them an empowering story can somehow decrease their existing perceptual bias she said

content: read m bellafante s story on the suggestion here we thought we d share a few more with you margaret cochran corbin   during the battle of fort washington in what is now washington height m corbin known a captain molly dressed a a man and joined the fight during the battle her husband john corbin wa shot and killed while manning a cannon m corbin stepped into his place loading the cannon until she wa wounded she wa captured by the british but later released she wa the first american woman to receive a military pension although it wa half the amount given to male soldier elizabeth jennings graham circa   m graham wa a young black schoolteacher who refused to give up her seat on a horse drawn streetcar while on her way to church in  she wa eventually thrown out by a policeman and then sued the city with the help of chester a arthur who would later become the president she won and the ruling eventually led to the desegregation of our city s public transit she also founded the city s first kindergarten for black child margaret sanger   m sanger a nurse coined the term birth control during her decade long fight to legalize contraception she founded the magazine woman rebel which wa often banned by the post office she wa charged with sending information about contraception through the mail she fled to europe but retuned to new york when the charge were dropped in  she opened the first birth control clinic in the united state in brownsville brooklyn other suggestion from reader for statue of inspiring woman include elizabeth cochrane seaman   known a nellie bly wa an american journalist whose trailblazing work in journalism often influenced public policy
title: New York Today: New York Today: Monumental Women

content: it s often what psychologist call the bystander effect it s a general term for people not reacting when they re in a group to some sort of situation that might call for a reaction where responsible intervention would be the right call but no one is intervening said katherine fox glassman a lecturer in the department of psychology at columbia university whose research ha focused on judgment decision making and risk perception the  murder of kitty genovese who wa attacked and stabbed repeatedly on her way home from work is one of the most cited reference to the bystander effect in new york city s history even though the role of the witness wa greatly disputed in later reflection and reporting the bystander effect can happen most anywhere after a bike accident a fight on the train or a fender bender but do cellphone exacerbate the phenomenon though it could simply be morbid curiosity m fox glassman explained it could also be bystander wanting video of an event a in case of possible police brutality the many recent example of people having film evidence of an event that wa later contested evidence allowing u to see what the truth wa that might be encouraging more people to film situation that seem ambiguous she said
title: New York Today: New York Today: The City’s Bystander Effect

content: discarded syrinx have become a significant concern for the town s resident who worry that the needle pose a threat to child and tourist those syrinx are a symptom of a broader systemic issue steve shockley a eureka resident who is homeless said he converted to using heroin a few year ago after year of drug abuse like many other longtime intravenous drug user in the area he now prefers heroin to meth though he us them both regularly stacy cobine who said she worked a a nurse s aide for many year say that many drug user are getting abscess from syrinx she said she had taught younger drug user proper needle technique to avoid infection and other complication you would not believe the dirty using practice i ve seen she said i just cringe thinking about it i ve had to teach a couple of my girlfriend kid how to do it right help them do it because it just made me so sad read the full story here we re interested in hearing from people who live in rural community in california what are the main issue facing your area what topic do you think have not received enough attention email our reporter jose a del real at jose delreal nytimes com please include your name town and a phone number if you would like u to follow up
title: California Today: California Today: The Opioid Crisis in Humboldt County

content: the problem is that the public in general and building owner in particular really think that when they get a building to code they are going to get a building that is going to perform fine in an earthquake said mary comerio a professor at the university of california berkeley and a proponent for stronger earthquake protection the message to the public is that existing building are going to be damaged that s built into the calculation professor comerio said they are designed to help you get out of the building but you may not be able to go back in a debate over the longstanding life safety philosophy of the building code meaning that it is designed to protect your life but not much more wa central to discussion at the conference a bill in sacramento that could potentially strengthen the code to a functional recovery standard is moving through committee in the state legislature but proponent of more resilient building and infrastructure like water gas line the power grid and cellphone system say more can be done even within the existing code maryann phipps a structural engineer who gave the keynote address to conference participant on thursday urged engineer to explain to their client that by spending an additional one or two percent a building is more likely to be usable after an earthquake
title: California Today: California Today: Making Earthquake Safety More Intelligible

content: we interrupt your summer to bring you some dreary news there s a chance we ll see rain every day this week with some heavy downpour and it will be uncomfortably humid but don t let the rain put a damper on going out may we suggest a film series to entertain you pioneer first woman filmmaker at bamcinmatek in downtown brooklyn is screening film from some of the first female moviemakers the series includes the film when little lindy sang  which touch on racial prejudice and tell the story of a black girl in a white classroom today at  p m and    thought to be the first western directed by a woman on wednesday the series screen the film of mable normand a largely overlooked silent era comedian who had equal success a a dramatic actor and the series wrap up on thursday with a screening of alla nazimova s salom  an adaptation of the oscar wilde play of the same name new york today is a morning roundup that is published weekday at  a m if you don t get it in your inbox already you can sign up to receive it by email here for new york today update throughout the day like u on facebook what would you like to see here to start your day post a comment email u at nytoday nytimes com or reach u via twitter using nytoday follow the new york today columnist alexandra s levine and jonathan wolfe on twitter you can find the latest new york today at nytoday com

content: we found it on the sidewalk in an industrial part of the neighborhood this is what we d call a desert mr kazimirov said a we picked up the bike you can see there s not much traffic here then a distress call came in about a bike in far rockaway it look like someone complaining that the bike is in front of their house mr kazimirov said after a bit of searching we found the bright green bike in a driveway on beach th street mr kazimirov quickly diagnosed the problem a broken lock probably jammed with sand the bike wa loaded into a white van and taken to the company s warehouse in bay ridge for repair so far mr kazimirov said he hasn t had to rescue bike from tree or body of water a dockless bike operator have had to do in other city and over the last few week the type of complaint have changed he said when we first put them out people would call in and say there wa an abandoned bike thinking that someone would steal them he said we d arrive and there d be nothing wrong it take awhile for people to realize that oh the bike can just be there and it doesn t have to be in a dock he added eventually they will just become part of the scenery here s what else is happening

content: to dismiss the role of climate change on these fire is simply incorrect said mr wehner who wa a lead author on a chapter of the fourth national climate assessment a series of federal summary of climate change data he made the point a most climate scientist do that the cause of the wildfire is multifold like in any complex event and this trend promise to continue according to the national climate assessment science report released last year the number of large forest fire in the western united state and alaska is projected to rise a the climate continues to warm so did the president capture the cause of the california wildfire accurately lisa the president s tweet said that the california wildfire were worsened by bad environmental law which aren t allowing massive amount of readily available water to be properly utilized virtually every scientist and forest management expert agreed that mr trump s tweet wa scientifically and factually inaccurate mr trump s other admonition that california must also tree clear to stop fire spreading raised fewer objection but state official pointed out california devoted more than   million in state fund this year alone on effort to reduce the risk of wildfire how about the president s point about water policy how is that related to wildfire management and firefighting is there any connection a the president suggested

content: one is that more landowner have joined the rank of making maple syrup she said with an estimated   producer across the state but the bigger reason is that technique for producing syrup have gotten better so that all of u who make syrup now make more syrup per tree than we did  or  year ago we ve also added tap maple season is in the early spring that s when the tree is taking the food stored in it root a starch and converting it into sugar m thomas explained but this week included the inaugural maple day at the great new york state fair visitor in syracuse watched cooking demonstration and sampled syrup soaked pancake maple sausage maple milk maple doughnut and maple cotton candy maple day wa certainly cause for celebration but the activity continues year round producer like m thomas whose farm near buffalo maxon estate farm ha been in the family for  year spend the fall in the wood preparing equipment in the late winter and early spring they are drilling hole into tree inserting tap spile and monitoring sap flow ideal weather for getting the job done is  degree by day and  by night m thomas said so when the time is right farmer must collect the sap quickly several time a day and then boil and process it immediately to prevent it from spoiling at the rate they re going m thomas said new york s maple producer hope to catch up with vermont behind u maine our industry is still very different from the vermont and the maine because we re still very much small family farm doing it she told u
title: New York Today: New York Today: A Maple Syrup Boom

content: last night the authority were still trying to piece together exactly what happened police commissioner james p oneill called the incident an absolutely tragic case of friendly fire chief of department terence a monahan said this is the worst thing that we go through a a department new york city police officer are rarely killed by friendly fire the last such incident occurred in  these death are rare in part because of the extensive training the police undergo retired police official said the paradox of policing is that youre always preparing for this but youre never ready for it said eugene odonnell a retired new york police officer who teach at john jay college of criminal justice in manhattan read our latest story about the shooting joseph l giacalone a retired new york police sergeant recalled stumbling upon a robbery in the bronx in  men with machine gun fired on him and his partner he said your instinct to stay alive take over mr giacalone said adding that even through all that is going on youre thinking about the person youre with because you want to make sure he or she come out of this o k also
title: New York Today: N.Y. Today: A ‘Friendly Fire’ Tragedy

content: but today come very welcome news subway speed limit are going to increase according to andy byford the head of the city subway it part of his plan to increase efficiency in the beleaguered system the times emma fitzsimmons report this morning over the weekend subway speed went from  mile per hour to a much a  on part of the n and r line in brooklyn this is all about getting the safe maximum out of the existing signaling system mr byford said mr byford plan to present his plan for speedier train at today meeting of the metropolitan transportation authority which oversees the subway he emphasized that the change should not affect safety context new york subway are scheduled to travel at about  mile per hour the slowest of any heavy rail system in the country according to a  analysis official plan to change the speed limit at  location by the spring why it matter where to begin the subway are miserable and although there been some improvement since mr byford took over about a year ago the system overall performance is worse today than when his bos gov andrew cuomo took office in
title: New York Today: N.Y. Today: Rejoice! Speedier Subways

content: where have mr zuckerberg and other facebook leader been in all of this you may ask good question the top brass at the company s headquarters in menlo park have been silent for day california online please note we regularly highlight article on news site that have limited access for nonsubscribers a powerful storm is barreling toward southern california prompting the third round of evacuation order in santa barbara county this month more than   have been told to evacuate the los angeles time photo new housing development on the south side of reno nev credit jason henry for the new york time the u s supreme court during oral argument signaled it hostility to a law requiring so called crisis pregnancy center in california to provide information about abortion service the new york time california s housing problem are spilling across it border to city like reno nev and others the new york time the sacramento police department clarified that a black man who wa shot  time and killed by officer wa not carrying a toolbar but instead a cellphone the sacramento bee the los angeles police department will now be required to release video captured by body camera and patrol car following a policy shift by the police commission the los angeles time the movement to deletefacebook ha gained steam in recent day the san francisco chronicle orange county may add homeless camp in three city part of newly approved spending totaling   million which will appropriated to fight the homeless problem the orange county register ten year ago gavin newsom a mayor of san francisco ordered that undocumented minor arrested for felony be reported to immigration and custom enforcement bay area news group san francisco s board of supervisor voted tuesday to ban the sale of fur within the city the san francisco chronicle dispatch visitor flock to the san bernardino national forest and two california state park armed with camera and spotting scope to see bald eagle the new york time the roxie theater in san francisco held a preview of wes anderson s new film isle of dog the screening wa b y o d bring your own dog the new york time photo rain cloud over san francisco earlier this month credit jeff chiu associated press and finally the rain storm hitting california this week have been called many thing but two related term keep popping up to describe this weather system atmospheric river and pineapple express so which one is it pineapple express wa a term for many year used to identify storm that came from hawaii and hit the west coast said marty ralph a research meteorologist affiliated with u c san diego s scripps institution of oceanography about  year ago we recognized that there s a broader definition called an atmospheric river and those happen all over the planet for non scientist atmospheric river can be conceptualized visually if you look from space from a satellite it doe look like a sinuous river said daniel swain a climate scientist at u c l a it s a colorful term and it s actually the official meteorological term to describe this process but while all pineapple express storm are atmospheric river not all atmospheric river are classified a pineapple express storm the source for the particular atmospheric river hitting california this week is near the hawaiian island hence the playful pineapple express not everyone agrees though that this storm fall under that category i wouldn t call this one a pineapple express the storm is coming from the west but the tail of this atmospheric river didn t come from hawaii it came from east of hawaii mr ralph said but i m not sure about arguing the jargon too much on this the modern term is atmospheric river nomenclature aside mr swain urged resident in burn area not to ignore the order because of storm fatigue though the storm may not hit los angeles too hard it could wallop those in santa barbara county the forecast is severe and if water fall too quickly it could lead to substantial flooding and mudslide the forecast is for a really really big rain he said maybe half a foot or more of water is going to fall in a lot of place that have had intense fire activity whether all those inch of rain fall over three day or in a six hour is hard to predict california today go live at  a m pacific time weekday tell u what you want to see catoday nytimes com california today is edited by julie bloom who grew up in los angeles and graduated from u c berkeley continue reading the main story

barometric pressure and tree and property damage which are used to verify the national weather service s weather advisory all of this made u think if a snowflake fall in brooklyn and no one is there to measure it doe it leave a record not according to the national weather service people call in and ask why their city or town is not on the snowfall list m buccola said it s likely because nobody content: a winter weather advisory is in effect until  p m which mean road could be slippery and visibility may be reduced but whatever you do don t call this storm a nor easter while we may have just celebrated a rare four easter with four nor easter pummeling our region within a month today s storm will not be the fifth the magnitude of this storm is not quite up to par said john murray a meteorologist with the national weather service for a storm to qualify a a nor easter he explained it must meet a few condition including sustained wind of  knot or around  mile per hour wind gust today are expected to reach only  mile per hour leaving the storm with the le sexy label of quick moving low pressure system which is a mixed blessing the storm is not strong enough to postpone the yankee home opener against the tampa bay ray but it s also not dumping enough snow to upset alternate side parking which is in effect today expect to forget all about it by this afternoon when we content: in brooklyn al smith mother katherine waited until after breakfast before leaving the brooklyn height home she shared with her daughter to vote for her son whom she recalled telling doubter when he first dabbled in politics he would amount to something some day youll see woman flocked to the poll early that day including mary garrett hay a suffrage leader on manhattan west side who spent two minute at the poll and reported that she had split her ticket it seemed a natural a breathing she said and i felt a though i had always voted the time reported dryly the next day the fact that woman voted for the first time at a general election made thing comparatively interesting at the polling booth but there wa no confusion and the woman a a rule voted with a little difficulty a the men new york today is a morning roundup that is published weekday at  a m if you dont get it in your inbox already you can sign up to receive it by email here what would you like to see here to start your day post a comment email u at nytoday nytimes com or reach u via twitter using nytoday follow the new york today columnist alexandra s levine azi paybarah and jonathan wolfe on twitter you can find the latest new york today at nytoday com

content: good morning on this radiant wednesday it ha been a bruising expensive and drawn out election season here in new york and it finally came to an end last night here are the big takeaway andrew m cuomo slide to victory mr cuomo won a third time in the race for governor of new york easily beating his republican rival marcus molinaro he ran on his record which includes same sex marriage gun control measure and paid family leave just like his father mr cuomo won a third term a governor and just like his father he ha denied that he ha presidential ambition read more about mr cuomos win democrat take new york seat in the house new york state had nine incumbent house republican out of  total house representative yesterday three of those republican lost their seat the most notable wa john j faso a republican who represented new york th congressional district whom antonio delgado defeated here in the city max rose defeated representative dan donovan in staten island and in central new york anthony brindisi beat representative claudia tenney democrat seize control of the state senate democrat won control of the new york state senate for the first time in nearly a decade the democratic senator andrea stewart cousin is slated to become the next majority leader which would make her the first black woman to lead the senate and the first woman to lead the state senate or assembly

content: fabscrap s founder jessica schreiber is expecting a glut of new stock because after fashion week everyone clean out when we visited this week volunteer picked fabric from garbage bag piled  foot high cotton wool and spandex are separated and smaller scrap are sent out to be made into fire blanket insulation and car door lining the good piece are meticulously organized by color and neatly folded in fabscrap s retail space photo jessica schreiber the founder of fabscrap credit holly pickett for the new york time last year fabscrap collected   pound of fabric enough to fill   shopping bag or create an equal number of head to toe look m schreiber  a former senior manager at the city sanitation department and self described trash nerd founded the nonprofit after noticing that new york s clothing recycling program didn t accept fabric the city collect reusable clothes and take it to goodwill she said it didn t really fit their model she started driving a u haul van around midtown picking up  pound bag of fabric from designer i got to know a lot of the freight elevator operator in the garment district she said she wa often told you work like a man she took it a a compliment m schreiber s goal is to one day collect scrap from clothing producer which generate a lot more waste than designer that s where you have the potential to make a real impact she said but for now she s looking to expand her network of over  volunteer who get free fabric and an important lesson when you walk in and see this pile of waste it s such an educational moment she said there s no better way to change what someone think about waste than for them to see it and put their hand on it here s what else is happening weather yesterday s slush is but a memory it will be sunny and dry content: people have been hurt last month chris wilson  a software developer needed eight stitch after slipping on the escalator at the south ferry station i wasn t walking down he said i wasn t actually doing anything my foot just sort of slipped out from under me it wa definitely the slickness on the floor theory have emerged some blame ice melt which can leave an oily residue when tracked in from the street others have suggested car exhaust or discarded fried chicken grease we asked the metropolitan transportation authority sham tarek a spokesman said the slippery floor are from the combination of rain and snow tracked in from the street other substance brought in on shoe and high humidity in station that trap moisture the buildup on the subway floor from shoe trash spill and exhaust contains substance that dissolve in water like salt and sugar along with oily compound which don t explained sanat kumar a professor of chemical engineering at columbia university you just don t notice the oily stuff until it rain or snow because it s caked together on the subway tile with everything else once you add water whatever didn t dissolve is going to be oily professor kumar said on nonporous subway tile where hardly anything is absorbed the slick stuff just sits on the surface a for why floor can seem more slippery on snowy day than on rainy day professor kumar theorized it s easier to carry snow in on your shoe so you ll have more water on the snowy day for now the m t a said it would continue to mop aggressively after both snow and rain the latter of which is expected to fall in profusion today once the snow change over in late morning look for a high around  tomorrow clearing but colder here s what else is happening in the news the national transportation safety content: the whole idea wa that the city wa being controlled by developer mr duskin said we said is this the future you want is this where you want to raise your kid both initiative failed but mr duskin say the threat of further vote against skyscraper led city official to impose height limit in residential area mr duskin continued his career a an activist campaigning against nuclear power and promoting wind energy today he speaks longingly of the day when rent were cheap and people came from all over the country to pursue career a poet author and artist in san francisco he reminisces about ample parking and whiling away afternoon at cafe where friend like lenny bruce or dick gregory would stop by to chat he rarely travel into san francisco any more it s lost it livability for people who aren t devoted just to making money it livability for people who want to do creative thing in the art he said it s over for me it s a different city california online please note we regularly been an odd few month of weather in the san francisco bay area with a january that felt like may and a waterlogged march of relentless storm the hail on monday which fell in part of the east bay
