content: new york voter turnout for federal election wa only slightly better about  percent of registered voter voted in the  general election according to the united state census only seven state had lower turnout rate than new york so why is that the turnout is exceptionally low because i hate to use the word our stupid policy mr muzzio said new york is one of the few state that doesn t allow early voting  others do the state also doesn t have same day registration the absentee voting system here is outdated and it doesn t accept online request and the cutoff to change party affiliation to vote in the tomorrow s primary wa in october new york is certainly behind the time and ha not gone the route of modern election reform said jonathan nagler a professor of politics at new york university and there s no political will to do this in the state legislature many new yorkers choose not to vote in the primary because they assume a democrat will ultimately win the general election but that s exactly the reason you should vote mr muzzio said in new york city the primary are often the general election because there s usually low competition between the party in the general election and with such a low turnout your vote is worth even more
title: New York Today: New York Today: Why We Don’t Vote

content: good morning on this feverish tuesday we are a week away from the primary democrat and republican in new york are holding nominating contest next tuesday for federal seat including the house and the senate state primary which include the governor s race will take place in september to get u up to speed on the most important and interesting race in the state we spoke to shane goldmacher the chief political correspondent on the time s metro desk here s what he s watching a heated race in new york city s trump country the most interesting republican primary certainly in new york possibly in the country is in staten island mr goldmacher said michael grimm once represented the th congressional district which includes staten island and part of southern brooklyn but resigned the seat in  after pleading guilty to tax fraud he served seven month in prison now he d like his old job back he s challenging representative dan donovan and the two are competing to see who s more aligned with president trump the president endorsed mr donovan but the swaggering mr grimm is the more trump like figure democratic upstart in the city a group of incumbent democrat in new york are facing primary challenger many of whom are first time candidate under the age of  representative joseph crowley who some see a possibly replacing nancy pelosi a the head of the house democrat is being challenged for the first time since  by the progressive candidate alexandria ocasio cortez representative carolyn maloney manhattan s east side and part of queen eliot engel the bronx yvette clarke central brooklyn and gregory w meeks southern queen are also facing insurgent within their party
title: New York Today: New York Today: Primary Races to Watch

content: good morning on this summer thursday a classroom around the city empty out for summer we learned about a group of student who recently completed a more unorthodox curriculum tending to a local graveyard the landmark green wood cemetery in brooklyn hosted  apprentice for a monthslong masonry restoration program teaching the art of repairing and preserving historic monument and building after finishing the course which began in march and wa supported by the world monument fund the graduate are now adept at nursing old structure made of marble granite brownstone and brick it s not in high demand everybody go the typical construction route said tiara campbell  a mason from east new york brooklyn who discovered the program through opportunity for a better tomorrow concrete worker carpenter plumber and electrician that s what everybody go for but what about the historic building he and his cohort worked on one of the more than  mausoleum in green wood the two story marble miller mausoleum one of the cemetery s largest built around  for the congressman william starr miller ii and his family who owned the fifth avenue mansion that became the neue galerie
title: New York Today: New York Today: Graduating From a Graveyard

content: good morning on this feverish thursday spotify user have created more than  playlist for the sole purpose of getting through the new york city commute from drake kanye and cardi b to easy listening melody like bon iver enya and norah jones the song you listen to on the way to and from work can affect your mood and overall well being research in music psychology and cognition confirms what many people already know loud fast music increase heart rate breathing and blood pressure while slower quieter music ha the opposite effect said joy calico a professor of musicology at vanderbilt university tailoring your commute playlist to how your day is going could be a benefit if the workday ha been exhausting and you are now trying to get up the energy to go to the gym that s one playlist m calico explained if you leave work furious with a co worker and that anger is threatening to follow you home that s another nina eidsheim a professor of musicology at u c l a agreed if a commuter s goal is to de stress or to have a productive workday using music i d encourage them to think about what music put them in which mood and to create their own highly personalized commuting playlist with that purpose in mind she told u
title: New York Today: New York Today: A Playlist for Commutes

content: but fame came to bernstein through a stroke of luck a jewish boy from the boston suburb bernstein moved to new york city in his early  and spent time playing piano at the village vanguard in the west village and working at a music publishing house at  he wa hired a an assistant conductor at the philharmonic normally all the assistant did wa to get the score ready read the mail do the chore take note that sort of thing mr burton said but one snowy sunday afternoon in  the guest conductor from germany wa sick and mr bernstein took over the program to great success lenny rode his luck and he wa front page news from then on mr burton said later a the philharmonic s musical director he turned it into the best orchestra in america mr burton added he used it a a political instrument mr burton said he went to berlin when the wall wa up he went to russia and made friend with the russian tried to a part of the nixon peace offensive and so on and he changed the face of music temporarily at least by making a generation maybe two very much more aware of classical music than they ever had before mr burton said he brought classical music into the home of american by insisting that the philharmonic s concert for young people were televised
title: New York Today: New York Today: A Leonard Bernstein Centennial

content: while the risk is mostly over the long term dr brissette said even just a few hour of very intense uv exposure can cause damage to the eye photokeratitis for example is the eye s equivalent of a sunburn here are some eye protection tip know when you re most at risk sunlight is strongest midday and early afternoon so be conscientious of that dr brissette said and it s not just summertime it s any time of the year because uv and sunlight can also be reflected off snow choose  percent protection most sunglass will have a sticker or tag indicating that they block  uv ray she said sometimes it say uv  another indication that there s uv protection in the sunglass polarized lens can cut down on glare and dark or colorful lens may help with contrast but neither necessarily protect your eye from the sun dr brissette said you ll still need the uv protection designation go bigger it s better small sunglass seem to be quite trendy but they can put you at an increased risk of uv exposure bigger oversized sunglass protect the light coming in on top and side dr brissette said you re protecting not only the eyeball but also the eyelid because you can get a number of skin cancer on the eyelid and it s difficult to apply sunscreen there
title: New York Today: New York Today: Protecting Your Eyes

content: good morning want to get california today by email here s the sign up the earthquake that struck eastern los angeles county on tuesday caused little damage but it wa a reminder of the seismic volatility in the foothill of the san gabriel mountain forty seven year ago a much more powerful earthquake struck sylmar about an hour s drive from the epicenter of tuesday s earthquake killing  people and severely damaging four hospital campus the consequence of that disaster are still being felt a law passed in  that ordered hospital to strengthen their most vulnerable building ha had unintended consequence across the state to nancy skinner a state senator in the east bay the seismic safety law ha been used a an excuse for a vital acute care hospital the alta bates summit medical center to shut down service at it berkeley location the hospital cite financial difficulty in funding the mandated retrofit whose deadline ha been pushed back several time and is now  there is also a  deadline for building to be able to not only withstand an earthquake but also remain operational official with sutter health the hospital system that run the alta bates summit medical center ha reassured local that service will remain intact and that the center will relocate several mile south to oakland but m skinner said the move which will result in some ambulance and patient having to use one of the most congested highway in america would have an extreme impact on her constituency the hospital controversy underscore a recurring problem in california resident want safer building but they fear the more immediate consequence of costly renovation
title: California Today: California Today: The Costs of Making Buildings Safer

content: the broader fight for the river said m cordalis is all about cultural restoration this is a story of cultural perseverance and of surviving assimilation and oppression i think a lot of our people who are on drug have that same feeling you want that culture back because you feel it in your heart and you believe in it and you know what s right she said until that i think people are really susceptible to all these bad influence related effort include the revival of their native language and the planned development of wellness village culturally appropriate site along the river that can serve a rehabilitation home where basket weaving and sweathouses will play a role tribal leader highlighted the success of young tribal member pursuing higher education at top tier school who they hope can come back home to the reservation and contribute to the cultural revival many struggling through drug addiction have found hope in reconnecting with tradition like codie donahue  who wound up homeless after he and his girlfriend became addicted to methamphetamine and heroin mr donahue who ha yurok and karuk lineage recently checked into a drug rehab program in eureka he ha been thinking a lot about the holy ceremony he once performed a a high priest for the karuk indian in the ritual he and others would pray in hope that the river would wash away the sin of his tribe
title: California Today: California Today: California Tribes Confront History and Heroin

content: if the forecast hold this could be the biggest spring snowstorm in our city s history new york city s largest snowstorm after the vernal equinox wa on april   when  inch fell for those lamenting spring s slow arrival note that thing could be worse the latest in the season that new york had substantial snowfall wa on april  in  when three inch fell on central park and a trace fell on may  in  this nor easter is forecast to drop more snow on new york city than the previous storm this month the last of which killed two people and left hundred of thousand in the region without power power failure are possible throughout the day like earlier this month we could see some thundersnow and lot of sleet what is sleet exactly sometimes what happens is that in between a cloud that s producing snowflake and the ground you get a layer of warm air mr homenuk said the snowflake from the cloud melt into a raindrop in the warm layer and then pass back into freezing air and then it refreezes into like an ice pellet unlike freezing rain which freeze after it hit the ground when it s sleeting you will know he added sleet sting it ping you it s not a gentle a a snowflake here s what else is happening

content: the two operation work in tandem to distribute news to the lap of theatergoer playbill s monthly circulation is about   million and increasingly the screen in their pocket the average operation we would have closed already said philip s birsh the president and chief executive of playbill photo playbill must be updated each week for every show a cast change credit sara krulwich the new york time some of that success can be attributed to mark peikert who wa hired by the magazine in  and ha broadened playbill s coverage to include more pop culture article and online broadcast of red carpet event his job lately ha been to channel the hamilton bump a surge in interest in theater news after lin manuel miranda s groundbreaking show and reach theater obsessive from hell s kitchen to kansa he s also given the print playbill a makeover in the past too many time the page would look like the new yorker all text mr peikert told u you don t want to sit in a dark theater and read content: dear diary i wa on an m bus heading west toward central park a usual the rider were insulating themselves against the world around them in one way or another at third avenue there wa a noise look daddy a child said to her father pointing down an egg carton had fallen out of a woman s bag off her lap and onto the floor the egg were rolling around every which way up and down the aisle and underneath the seat yet none of them broke and the woman seemed strangely unperturbed looking around she realized what we were all thinking they re all hard boiled she said then like a swat team the people on the bus sprang into action a man who had been dreamily stroking his beard dived for a couple of the egg a they glided by call you back a young woman said into her phone putting it into her pocket and scooping up an egg a it rolled over her toe a poodle yipped at a wayward egg meandering toward it owner who captured it between her high heel and retrieved it daintily between two finger within a few block the bus wa transformed into a rolling hub of community action and before the driver could say madison avenue all dozen egg had been accounted for and returned to their owner with much laughter and good will

content: good morning want to get california today by email here s the sign up one day it wa at an intersection not far from the veteran affair hospital in westwood what doe that man s sign say she asked from her car seat a couple of week later she asked about the woman i handed a  bill to outside my car not long after that a we got off the freeway near venice she spotted them before i did mommy why are there are those tent there she said pointing to a grassy clearing near the off ramp i do not try to shield my two young child from seeing the homeless people we pas a we go about our life in los angeles and i always try to answer the many question that come from my kid age  and  still every time i try to explain why people are homeless and what we can do about it i find myself worrying that i am doing it all wrong last month a young couple set up a tent on a corner two block from our home which mean my child pas it daily on the way to and from school the kid have asked about it almost every time we see it why do they have a dog how did they buy the tent where do they cook the food they re eating even when i m flummoxed by the question i silently hope that they keep coming i do not want them to become inured to the sight of people sleeping on sidewalk under freeway overpass and on bus stop bench we ve packed bag filled with toiletry for the homeless along with many other young family from our school but most of u are reluctant to take our child to deliver them a one friend put it i am worried about what the impact of seeing thousand upon thousand of homeless people on skid row will do to my already anxious  year old another friend said she tried to always carry food in the car so that her child can point out someone they think who might need help offering them toothbrush and bandage that they carry a well

content: when m jennings tried to hop on the conductor stopped her and told her to wait for a car with her people in it i then told him that i had no people m jennings wrote and she boarded the car anyway although new york had abolished slavery nearly  year before many restaurant church and school were still segregated public transportation car were marked with placard announcing whether african american were allowed on board get out the conductor ordered i answered again that i wa a respectable person born and raised in new york m jennings said and that he wa a good for nothing impudent fellow for insulting decent person while on their way to church the conductor tried to pull m jennings from the car but she held onto the window frame photo the corner of pearl and chatham street where elizabeth jennings hailed a horse drawn streetcar on her way to church credit emmet collection new york public library you shall sweat for this he said he drove without making stop to a corner on the bowery and called over a police officer the officer sided with the conductor and pushed m jennings onto the street breaking her bonnet and dirtying her sunday attire the officer tauntingly told me to get redress if i could m jennings wrote hour later she filed a lawsuit against the third avenue railway company the operator of the streetcar with the help of a lawyer chester a arthur who would later become our st president the court ruled in her favor granting her   in damage and allowing all african american to use public transit a long a they were sober well behaved and free from disease a a result of the ruling within five year the city s streetcar were largely integrated m jennings went on to found the city s first kindergarten for african american child at her home on west st street her story of defiance may not be widely known but in  a sign reading elizabeth jennings place went up at the corner of spruce street and park row  year and a few block from where she refused to get off the streetcar here s what else is happening weather you knew it wouldn t last our balmy weather is gone today will be cold gray and wet expect rain mostly after  a m and temperature to fall to content: the average new yorker already work  hour and  minute a week longer than their counterpart in the next  largest city in the u s according to a  report by the city comptroller and that s not including hour spent emailing at home a  study found that on average worker spend an extra eight hour a week sending email after work research ha also shown that people who responded to work communication after  p m had a worse quality of sleep and were le engaged the next day when you don t have recovery and time off it lead to more stress and ultimately burnout and exhaustion said larissa k barber a professor of psychology at northern illinois university who conduct research on work life balance and coined a term for this phenomenon telepressure but now that round the clock communication are ingrained in the way we work some business might view cutting out these communication a shortening the workday and hurting their bottom line said sonia marciano a professor of management and organization at new york university s stern school of business the best solution to fatigue from after work work she said wa an honest conversation about expectation between employer and employee unfortunately she said those conversation rarely happen what are your thought on responding to electronic communication after hour should we have a law in new york that prevents company manage it here s what they said i live in a multilevel private house when i go up to my bedroom in the evening i leave the cellphone on the charger downstairs in the kitchen that way i am le tempted to respond to email or call from my consulting client or graduate student after the dinner hour of course occasionally i take the laptop with me which defeat the purpose melba butler  jamaica queen being a freelancer mean i don t really have off hour a soon a a work related email text or phone call come in the response clock star ticking down unless i m asleep teaching or playing a gig i respond inbox first thing on the next business day carolyn robinson wooster ohio a few year ago i wa disgusted with myself because i d become an addicted smartphone drone i took the radical step of canceling my phone service and rejecting permanent connectivity i got a computer phone number so i could get text make call when at a wi fi hot spot and told people to leave me a message and i d get back to them business associate envied my resolve but didn t feel it would work it ha i am a liberated person now free at last free at last arthur kaye  chappaqua n y i m on the clock   but i choose to be i content: im a big fan of making list i have a list of thing i need to get done the month another list is broken out into thing i need to do this week and yet another list of thing that need to be completed in a day for me and how i work theyre great for keeping me organized and i get a lot of satisfaction in crossing yet another item off my list here is how many of u make our daily to do list in the am fueled by coffee and morning read more read today list is a slack app that brings that daily list component to slack where presumably youre already spending a lot of time in your day and if youre not using slack this one isnt for you once installed youll need to be an admin for your slack you can use the app to create a list for the day that truly is a list for the day everything on it expires in  hour which in an of itself is motivation to get thing done thing can be added to your list by typing today add and then the task or marked complete by typing today complete followed by the talk you want to mark done you can also type today list into any channel during the day to list all of the task you currently have on your list to complete the idea here is to collect those task that someone mention in slack in real time so you dont forget them if you find yourself losing task during the day it can be a quick and easy way to keep track of them
title: Create Daily To-Do Lists Within Slack With Today List

content: dairy queen is celebrating the official first day of spring today by handing out free ice cream cone to score yours you just have to show up at any dairy queen and ask for one the deal only applies to small vanilla cone so if you want something more exciting youll still have to pay the deal also doesnt apply in mall location so if thats the only dq near you youre out of luck you can find out where you can snag one of the free cone near you on this map on dairy queen site like most good promotion there also a limit of one per person although were guessing you could probably hit up a few different location if you want to celebrate the first day or spring with your own personal free ice cream crawl
title: How to Get a Free Cone at Dairy Queen Today

title: Hot to Get Free Ice Cream at Ben & Jerry's Today

content: of the many many article ive read and written about setting goal over the past few year the one thing thats stuck with me thats worked in my own life is to focus on small action you can accomplish today you should absolutely set long term goal and plan but to be successful in accomplishing them you need to take it step by step in a way it the opposite of dont miss the forest for the tree you dont want to get too caught up in meaningless detail that you cant finish anything but by zeroing in on what you can feasibly do in any given day youre lessening the stress of thinking about all of the thing you must do and just well doing them not to get too morbid but were all going to die some of u sooner than expected a this piece read more read this is particularly true of financial goal which almost always seem overwhelming and actually make a difference in our life each and every day right now for example im working on ratcheting up my emergency fund if i think about the total number i want to reach   its overwhelming and can even be a deterrent but by breaking that down into daily or weekly action ive been able to make some headway not much mind you but some and it feel pretty good now consider something like retirement if youve read an article that say you should have  million to retire comfortably you might be put off from saving all together it seems like such an enormous out of reach figure one thats even a little hard to comprehend fully but if you can put that aside for a moment and think about a small concrete step you can take todaysay open a roth ira and invest   to get startedyoure closer to reaching that goal than you were while performing bach prelude from suite no  for nprs tiny desk concert series cellist yo yo read more read that mean forgiving yourself when and if you mess up or if it taking you longer than youd like to get started progressing toward a goal so maybe you dont have nearly enough saved or investedwho care if you focus on what you can do today to get to where you want to be and you keep doing that day after day youll accomplish what you set out to if you slip up one day well it not the end of the world you can just pick back up tomorrow today im focusing on finishing up my work tidying my apartment and setting the groundwork for a more structured budget i wont have    in my saving account by the end of the day but thats ok for now for today focus on today then when tomorrow come focus on tomorrow you can only take it one day at a time
title: Focus on Today, Not Just on the Future

content: right on cueit being apple announcement day and allthe service oriented tech giant ha released the latest version of it io operating system if you dont already have it or have yet to receive the notification that an io update is available simply tap on your setting app gt general gt software update to begin the download itll take a while it took me about an hour or so to download and install the update on a reasonably fast internet connection while you wait here are some of the big feature you can look forward to with the update apple news you can now pay apple   mo to consolidate your many magazine subscription into a single digital package if youre on the fence about apple offering you do get a one month trial to play around with the new service dont forget to cancel it if you dont want it however a youll automatically be billed for the next month subscription if you forget and a apple noted today you can share your subscription with up to six family member via apple family sharing feature anyone feel like adopting me canada finally get apple news stop the press canadian apple fan can now read the news via apple self titled appeither in french or english of course more silly animoji if you like turning your head into animal and sending quirky little virtual video or picture if you just tap your fake noggin to your friend youre in luck you now get a giraffe a shark a warthog and an owl hey apple open up an app store for animoji and let other people create safe for work virtual creation you could probably make even more service revenue siri and apple tv update your apple tv to tvos   and your io device s to io   and youll be able to control whats on your apple tv with a lot more granularity a macrumors note tvos   when paired with io   is designed to allow user to ask siri to play specific medium on an apple tv from an io device you can for example ask siri to play modern family on the tv in the living room or pitch perfect on the tv in the bedroom this feature is available for music tv show and movie that g e icon if youre an at amp t subscriber you might see a new g e icon in the upper right corner of your iphone you can now brag to your friend that you have an even better mobile connection than they do and they can remind you that g e is just at amp t bullshit way to say faster lte since your iphone a of when we wrote this doesnt actually support g connectivity whatsoever isnt friendship grand higher quality audio message this is a simple one but apple ha boosted the quality of the audio message you leave in message by adopting a different codec opus at  hz instead of the previous amr narrowband codec at  hz neat more specific screen downtime you can now customize which day and time you want to schedule downtime via io screen time feature a a reminder if your phone is in downtime mode youll only be able to use certain apps you choose and your device phone app thats it sorry facebook group facetime is back yes that horrible group facetime bug that allowed others to eavesdrop on what you were doing is gone and the feature is back for all to use enjoy your brady bunch like conversation promotion for subscription apps apple is now allowing app developer to offer promotional pricing for subscription so youll want to be a bit more judicious about when you sign up for that which you want to pay a recurring fee to access a apple io   release note describe apps with auto renewable subscription can provide a discounted price for a specific duration for existing and previously subscribed customer you can use subscription offer to help win back subscriber who have canceled their subscription or promote an upgrade to another subscription at a special price customer can accept the offer even if theyve already completed an introductory offer air quality in apple map if you live in a location thats prone to problem with air quality hi northern california youll now be able to view the air quality index right within apple map ala you cant superimpose some colorful filter over your map to see what the air is like for specific location but youll get a little indicator in the lower right corner for whatever location youre viewing when zoomed in enough you can also toggle this or the weather condition on and off via the setting app more support for apple stuff or stuff that work with apple protocol if you have a fancier airplay  friendly television youll now be able to add it to homekit similarly io   offer full support for apple newest airpods a well a the logitech crayon for your ipad pro telling airplay to chill out youll now be able to do other thing while youre using airplay to cast content from an io device to say your apple tv a apple description note airplay multitasking for video allows you to browse other apps a well a play other short form audio and video file locally on your device without interrupting airplay i think redditor rfguevar put it best holy hell im internally jumping with joy in a meeting map your latest apple pay transaction apple updated the wallet ui a bit to make your latest apple pay transaction a lot more pleasant to look at youll see the business the location and the amount you spent and tapping on the listing will take you right to a more detailed information screenincluding a map that show you the retailer location the epic debut of airpower just kidding and speaking of disappointment apple is also geofencing the ecg setup process for the apple watch in io   so those of you who dont live in the u s wont be able to initialize it sorry marking podcasts a played for whatever reason apple previously removed the ability to mark a podcast a played within it podcasts appafter pressing and holding or deep pressing a podcast episode well that feature is back in io   safari search are easier to autofill if you love using safari on io apple ha tweaked the autofill aspect of the address bar slightly start typing something when you see the recommended search phrase appear on your screen you can tap on the phrase itself to immediately go to the search result for that phrase now however you can also tap on a new blue arrow icon to just place that text in the address bar in case you want to modify your search query even more
title: Download iOS 12.2 Today and Try Out These New Features

content: apple is set to release a slew of software update today that it announced last week including io  watchos  and tvos  there isn t an official release time for any of the update but if the company hold to tradition apple should start rolling thing out around pm et am pt per to mac the iphone x and xr come with a number of fun new live photo wallpaper a well some wallpaper read more read if you plan on getting the update today now s a good time to go ahead and backup your iphone in anticipation of the main event you re going to want to make sure to do that today before you download the update just in case thing get dicey and you end up having to unexpectedly do a hard reset on your device it s always better to be safe than sorry especially when you re dealing with a new version of an o also keep in mind that downloads are likely to take longer than normal today right when the update drop simply because everyone on the planet is trying to download and install the update at the same time if you need your phone for a conference call mid day you may want to wait until afterwards to start the process a good rule of thumb is to pick a time where your device can be mia for at least an hour if that s going to cut thing close then wait until later io  you ll find io  on your iphone or ipad by going into the setting menu followed by general and then software update updating your device requires you to be connected to wifi and have at least  of your battery charged or have your device plugged in watchos  if you have an original apple watch then you re going to be left out of today s o update for everyone else the update can be found by going to the watch app on your iphone and selecting general followed by software update tvos  you ll find tvos  by clicking into the setting app on your apple tv and then selecting update software and keep in mind that the first release of a new o also tends to be a bit buggy you also might want to consider waiting a day or two to see how everyone else is faring with the update before downloading them onto your own device
title: How to Get Apple's iOS, watchOS, and tvOS Updates Today

content: nasa is landing a spacecraft on mar today and you can actually watch it happen in real time nasa mar interior exploration using seismic investigation geodesy and heat transport lander yes thats a mouthful is expected to touch down on mar around pm et pm pt nasa call it insight for short and you should too a an adult seeing snail mail with your name on it is kind of a drag bill bill bill postcard read more read the first mar landing since  when nasa landed the curiosity rover on the planet this landing will kick off a two year mission for insight whose main goal is to study mar interior the hope is that through studying the planet scientist will be able to understand more about how all rocky world are formed including our own if you want to catch the landing in person you do you can watch the event online on nasa broadcast tv station the broadcast is set to run from   pm et am  pm pt you can find that livestream here if youd rather experience the event with other space buff there are also a ton of viewing party being held across the united state a well a a few international location where you can catch the action with others big option to note are time square on the nasdaq screen the smithsonian and the los angeles central library you can check out a full list of viewing party option here
title: How to Watch NASA's Insight Land on Mars Today

content: should we break up amazon and facebook columbia law school academic fellow lina khan who wrote the impactful amazon s antitrust paradox for the yale law journal join verge editor in chief nilay patel to discus whether amazon and facebook should be broken up and what it might look like if that were to happen you can listen to their discussion about the case for breaking up amazon and facebook in it entirety on the vergecast right now below is a lightly edited excerpt from the interview nilay patel you wrote a paper for yale law review called amazon s antitrust paradox walk u through the argument you made there lina khan sure so the argument i made wa that amazon is a really elegant illustration of how the current framework in antitrust the consumer welfare framework really fails to capture form of market power and form of dominance that should be relevant to antitrust and do raise competition concern and so i wa writing about amazon because i think aspect of amazon s business strategy specific practice that it used to become a dominant a it is are a really useful vessel for talking about these broader shift in antitrust and so you know before i went to law school i wa a journalist and a policy researcher and had spent some time interviewing the merchant that sell on amazon just to try and understand it you know what are the business practice here what are the contractual term what are the kind of day to day reality for these million of merchant that feel dependent on amazon right they feel that the only way they can really get to market in the internet age is by using amazon by selling on amazon and then also by interviewing investor hedge fund venture capitalist to try and see how wall street wa thinking about amazon and the dominance it wa amassing those perspective the kind of people who have money on the line and interacting with amazon and how they see the company really helped shape how i think about the company s power and then thinking about how these people were thinking about amazon and then thinking about how current antitrust law perceives amazon just revealed this gap i wa interested in exploring this back gap and interested in thinking about how antitrust should be reformed in order to reflect the new reality of how market power get exercised and so the really tl dr version of where we are right now with antitrust a a standard is something called the consumer welfare standard which if you ve been listening to the vergecast we talk about a lot actually but it s the notion that there s only an antitrust problem if price are going up right if company consolidate a part of the market they have a monopoly they raise consumer price there s some harm we should break that up to add more competition but if price are stable or going down you probably don t have a problem and amazon obviously ha very low price but they have all this ancillary power all across the rest of the internet basically google s price are zero so it s very hard to articulate a harm in facebook right or we pay in data i m reluctant to say that there are free service but the dollar amount we pay is zero that s right
title: What Amazon tells us about antitrust today

content: even if you don t do a ton of home improvement project everyone should own a good drill driver and today s gold box deal fit the bill despite being a v model this brushless bosch pack a punch and carry a   star review average and unlike most cordless drill that hang a bulbous battery pack off the bottom of the handle bosch s v tool use a slimline design where the battery fit entirely within the handle making the drill far more maneuverable in tight space you may remember a similar gold box deal earlier this week for a few buck le but today s deal is for the brushless version of the drill which should last longer and be better at managing it battery life it s a   discount from it usual price but it s only available today or until sold out

content: it is perfectly normal for distracting thought to enter your head m duckworth said try returning your focus to your breath m brach also offered a tip during practice when you realize the mind ha been distracted pause for a moment and without judgment reawaken your sens become aware of the sound around you the sensation and feeling throughout your body the feeling of your breath knowing how to step out of the incessant inner dialogue that perpetuates stress and re grounding in the present moment brings much freshness creativity clarity and ease to our heart and mind my bos is on his eighth egg nog at the office party and i need to center myself do i need to find a quiet conference room to meditate distraction free location are not necessary for meditation the expert said but they are recommended for beginner with practice you might be able to meditate during your commute and eventually m brach said you can practice informal meditation or meeting life with a non judging openhearted presence during all the activity of life conversation creative endeavor sport eating lovemaking and taking a shower aside from filling the air with the scent of gingerbread what is the best way to breathe during meditation many meditators recommend breathing in through the nose and out the mouth m duckworth said but there s no right or wrong way really the purpose of paying attention to the breath is to help collect the attention quiet the mind and more fully notice the experience of the present moment m brach said you will find that what deepens your meditation is not how you re attending to your breath such a breathing through the nose the mouth or into the belly but the quality of the attention itself here s what else is happening weather if your mood depends on the weather you might not need to assume a lotus pose today we re expecting a serene and sunny fall day with a high of  tomorrow is looking even warmer in the news it s not just the subway that are in bad shape a new report detail the extent to which new york city bus have been neglected new york time photo new york city bus carry over two million passenger a day but many of their route no longer match commuting pattern credit bryan thomas for the new york time newly unsealed document reveal that in  donald j trump paid over  million to settle a case involving illegal immigrant who year earlier had worked to demolish the building to make way for trump tower new york time a stolen boat that the authority thought wa a part of a terrorist plot actually turned out to be used in a new jersey man s late night drunken adventure new york time in camden n j a marker ha been put up to commemorate the arrival of african who were sold into bondage new york time the coffee maker chock full o nut now includes a disclaimer of no nut on it container intended for consumer beyond new york new york time columbia university s recently acquired collection of photograph taken in s puerto rico showcase how poverty ha persisted on the island new york time photo woman getting water in puerto rico credit jack delano via columbia university victor j blue for the new york time bodycam footage of a suicide response call showed a chaotic  second showdown that ended when the police shot a man in the leg new york daily news the city s department of transportation is entertaining the prospect of allowing a new dockless bike share program curbed ny councilman jumaane williams want to increase term limit for the city council allowing it member to serve for more than a decade bklyner brooklyn s second apple store will open over the weekend brownstoner a couple s dark time inspired them to volunteer for a queen program that organizes event for adult with developmental disability new york time today s metropolitan diary a true broadway baby for a global look at what s happening see your morning briefing coming up today visit the holiday market at columbus circle open through dec   a m to  p for a holiday gift for a youngster on your list the new york public library recently released it  best book for kid and  best book for teen list for this year compiled by a committee of librarian among the top child s book were bravo poem about amazing hispanic by margarita engle the goat by anne fleming and the new ocean the fate of life in a changing sea by bryn barnard for teenager the top book included the  bus by dashka slater how dare the sun rise by sandra uwiringiyimana and what girl are made of by elana k arnold we also wanted to know what new york kid are choosing for themselves content: another iphone day is now behind u and even the most skeptical apple fan might be asking themselves wa that it we got three new iphones and a new apple watch that s it to be reasonable  is an off year for apple it s an s year a time when the company bump spec rather than completely overhauling it iphones apple announced two new iphones with an s after the name the iphone x and the iphone x max the third device is called the iphone xr which represents a new naming scheme and might be the most interesting of the bunch and again being reasonable the apple watch did get it first ever redesign everything apple announced this year still seems a little underwhelming though despite the fact that the sheer number of new spec seems a little bit overwhelming however apple failed to announce a lot of thing that a lot of people expected including a new ipad pro with face id a cheap macbook and a release date for it long awaited airpower charging pad oh well let s break down what apple did announce apple iphone x this is the one that had to happen a year after apple revealed the iphone x before letting everyone know that it wasn t quite ready for primetime the company announced a solid update to the first face id enabled device the iphone x look almost identical to it predecessor there s the same   inch oled display that stretch fill up nearly the entire span of the iphone s screen which come encased in stainless steel and what apple call the most durable front glass ever in a smartphone what s left is the now famous notch which house the same face id hardware a before but apple say that new software make face id faster than before the oled display itself is also supposed to show  percent greater dynamic range in hdr photo the real gut update of the iphone x is a new a bionic processor that come in the form of apple s first  nanometer chip the new processor come with a six core fusion architecture including two performance core that apple say are  percent faster there s also a four core gpu that s supposedly  percent faster and an eight core neural engine that can handle  trillion operation per second compared to the a bionic processor s  billion those are all apple s bragging number so we ll have to test it out in processor hungry environment like game and augmented reality to see if the improvement make a difference many trillion of process per second sure sound impressive though the other noteworthy upgrade included with the iphone x involves the camera on the outside the new iphone dual camera system look a lot like it predecessor but the component have been updated there are two new  megapixel sensor on the rear camera that are faster and include larger pixel a well a a new true tone flash module meanwhile the new a bionic chip offer better image processing including improved low light performance and portrait mode the new iphone x come in space grey silver and an all new gold finish you can choose between a gb gb and a new gb model price start at   pre order start friday september  and the device ship on friday september  apple iphone x max this new iphone represents a familiar trick it s just the iphone x but bigger the size is notable for a couple of reason though first apple released the iphone x in only one size   inch second the iphone x max s   inch display is the biggest apple ha ever released for an iphone the device itself is about the same size a an iphone  plus but it incorporates the same bezel free design a the iphone x and iphone x that mean it come with face id a well a all the same hardware upgrade a the iphone x including the a bionic processor improved camera and gb storage option based on apple s presentation however the only thing that the iphone x max offer besides the bigger screen is a bigger battery apple say it s the biggest one it s ever offered on an iphone the iphone x max come in all the same color and storage option a the iphone x the device start at   and ship alongside the iphone x apple iphone xr this one s kinda kooky earning the famous one more thing billing at the apple event the iphone xr look a lot like the   inch iphone x except it s a little bit bigger and a lot cheaper it also come in many color the iphone xr come with a   inch lcd display that come in the familiar notched design wrapped up in an aluminum frame and the new more durable glass it s notched because this iphone ha face id and no home button just like it pricier sibling apple call the new lcd a liquid retina display that s supposed to look better than it predecessor the iphone xr also lack a second rear camera but apple found a way to pull off portrait mode using software thanks to the a bionic processor which is included in this cheaper model so the iphone xr is a lot like the iphone x except it ha an lcd screen an aluminum frame and only one camera that doesn t sound so bad when you consider the fact that this device start at   which is cheaper than the launch price of the iphone  the iphone  now start at   and the iphone  start at   you can also get the iphone xr in six pretty color white black blue yellow and coral unfortunately you will have to wait for this intriguing cheaper iphone the iphone xr will be available for preorder on october  and will hit store on october  apple watch series  this one is exciting for lover of subtle design upgrade and heart health the apple watch series  come with a thinner case a larger screen and a new heart rate sensor that can also do electrocardiogram ecg also it know if you fall down the fourth generation apple watch is presented a the sleekest health device on the market there s an improved accelerometer that not only know if you ve fallen down but also how you did it e g trip slip straight up lost it the updated heart rate sensor which is encased in a ceramic shell with sapphire crystal will also tell you more about how your heart beat and will even make it easy to print out those record and take them to your doctor the device ha been certified by the fda on top of the health stuff the apple watch is just a little better and nicer on all other front it come in slightly larger mm and mm that importantly have  percent more screen real estate they also have a new digital crown with haptic feedback that will now buzz back at you a you turn it the secondary button now sits flush with the case too the apple watch series  start at   for the gps only model and   for the gps plus cellular model that bump the price of the series  back to   and up the fourth generation watch come in with a silver gold or space grey aluminum case you can get stainless steel in silver space black and a new gold color apple will start taking order on the series  watch september  and the device will start shipping september
title: Everything Apple Announced Today

content: apple highly anticipated celebrity studded service event didnt disappoint in two specific regard one there were a lot of celebrity present two there were also a lot of new service announced it hard to say which wa more exciting in a way the celebrity were an afterthought apple opened the event with several major upgrade to existing apps and service starting with a new magazine and newspaper subscription offering called apple news then came a new apparently very slick credit card called the apple card there also an entirely new gaming service called apple arcade then the new apple tv app and the completely new apple tv service which wa the part all the celebrity talked about it wa a weird apple event if only because there never really been one like it while it weirdly felt like an award ceremony at timeswith hollywood a lister patting themselves and apple on the back for doing great thingssome of the new apple service look pretty cool let talk through them apple news tim cook opened up the event with a cute little story about how he like going to the newsstand and looking at all the magazine cover this is quaint because it increasingly hard to find a newsstand which is probably why apple talked about enlisting over  magazinesincluding national geographic popular science billboard the new yorker sport illustrated new york magazine and varietyfor it new apple news program apple news will show up a a new tab in the apple news app the new tab essentially look like a redesigned version of texture a digital magazine subscription service that apple acquired last year apple news is pretty straightforward for   a month you get access to all those magazine a well a some newspaper including the los angeles time and the wall street journal you will not get access to the new york time or the washington post apparently because apple wanted to keep half of the subscription fee apple news will work on the iphone ipad a well a the mac apple also say the new subscription service will not allow advertiser to track what you read and target ad accordingly apple news will be available through a software update later today you can get a free one month trial once you update and again it   a month after that you do get family sharing for up to six member included for that price which make the whole thing pretty darn cheap if youre a family of six people who love to read apple card tim cook say that apple pay is incredibly successful so successful that apple is expanding it by offering it own credit card with help from goldman sachs for now the new apple card will only exist in digital form inside of apple wallet and will let you it through apple pay a physical card made of titanium will be available later this summer it all white with a little apple logo on it but wont have your name or credit card number or anything to ensure your privacy this information will be available in the apple wallet app the new apple card actually sound a lot like a regular credit card you do get some reward  percent cash back apple call this daily cash on apple purchase  percent on other purchase and  percent on purchase made with the physical card you also get some tool within the wallet app that help you track and categorize your spending a well a make smart decision when it come to making payment notably there are no annual fee no late fee no hidden fee no international fee no over the limit fee according to apple no fee a the fine print on apple website point out however missing payment will lead to increased interest charge our friend over at lifehacker say it a pretty average reward card and were inclined to agree the apple card will be available later this summer you can sign up to get notified about availability on apple website apple arcade because march wouldnt be complete without another video game service announcement apple just gave u a preview of apple arcade the name is actually handily descriptive because the service is basically a whole section of game built just for apple device and only available on apple device to be more specific apple arcade will become a new section of the app store and for a fee youll get access to over  exclusive title made by some of the top studio there will even be a sonic the hedgehog game and a new version of frogger another cool thing about apple arcade is that all the game work offline so you can play on a plane or the subway the game also work on different platform so you can start playing on an iphone and then pick up where you left off with an apple tv device apple arcade game will be ad free and wont have any in app purchase a far a how much the service itself will cost however we dont yet know apple say the service will go live this fall and will cost money you will also get family sharing for up to six people included in the price apple tv and apple tv okay these were technically two separate announcement but were rolling them into one section here because it otherwise confusing basically apple is updating the apple tv app thats already on million of io and apple tv device apple is also making a version of the apple tv app available for mac a well a a bunch of smart tv platform made by company like samsung and lg on top of that apple will also make apple tv apps for set top box from roku and amazon apple tv is a whole new thing on top of the new apple tv some might even say it wa the star of today event since announcing all of the new show and celebrity involved took like an hour and a half the new paid subscription video service appears to resemble an hbo competitor more than say netflix it will live in the new apple tv app the exclusive programming frankly sound pretty cool there a steven spielberg led reboot of the sci fi series amazing story a comedy about a tv morning news show starring reese witherspoon jennifer aniston and steve carrell something called sea with jason momoa and alfre woodard that sound simply trippy the way momoa described it at the event and little america a show about immigrant and child of immigrant produced by kumail nanianji those are just to name a few oh and ophrah is going to do a couple of documentary again apple declined to offer any detail about exactly how much apple tv would cost it will start rolling out this fall with new programming being added every month there are also a lot more celebrity and tv people involved than the one that were on stage at the event we cant wait to see if all this very expensive looking programming will be better than apple first attempt at original content carpool karaoke and planet of the apps it honestly not a very high bar to clear
title: Everything Apple Announced Today

content: this spring new york announced it first nightlife mayor the appointee ariel palitz is responsible for mediating between city resident and local bar club and other night life venue fielding concern from both side and working with all party literally and figuratively to keep the peace now meet your neighbor helping m palitz fourteen new yorkers from community activist to d j s to lawyer have been named to the nightlife advisory board tasked with making policy recommendation for late night establishment among the member are the rapper kurtis blow the chairman of the universal hip hop museum the local composer and producer dj tikka masala the drag artist and l g b t q activist marti gould cummings the liquor licensing attorney robert bookman and environmental attorney andrew praschak a longtime leader from community board  in manhattan susan stetzer and other artist businesspeople and advocate appointed by the mayor and city council i am thrilled to welcome the member of the new nightlife advisory board which represents a cross section of stakeholder in both the industry and community affected by it said julie menin commissioner of the mayor s office of medium and entertainment working together i know we can help night life establishment comply with well thought out regulation while ensuring that our community maintain the kind of quality of life they deserve
title: New York Today: New York Today: What Is This Object?

content: this one is for the hardcore novel writer who are doubting themselves the one who committed earlier this month to writing   word in  day but then uh something happened good morning national novel writing month participant did you do your  word this morning read more read a a person who ha completed this challenge ten year in a row including my  novel on thanksgiving day i have some important information it is totally normal even among national novel writing month winner finisher to spend some part of the month in a word deficit that feel like a black hole you ll never climb out of but there s hope i d venture that if you have   word or le left to go you can bust them out today if you re down to   that s gravy your individual writing speed may vary but if you can get the condition just right word will pour out of you here are some thing to try pretend you re in hawaii if you re toiling away tonight and the clock flip to midnight that s it the month is over but since the world is round it really is i promise it s always midnight somewhere that s why i advise you to change your time zone on the nanowrimo website so that you can still log a win late tonight when it s midnight on the east coast it s only pm in hawaii you buy yourself an extra five hour with this trick which i am convinced is not cheating it s just virtual travel if you already live in hawaii i m afraid you are too close to the international date line to buy much time the best you can do is pretend you re in pago pago samoa and that ll buy you an extra hour get suddenly sick i m not saying you should lie to your bos or to the friend who are expecting you at some party or funeral or whatever but if you were to get sick your bos or friend would totally understand that you have to stay home plan an evening of word sprint okay now you have time to write but you need some reason to stay at your desk some engine pushing you on to actually finish this thousand word and the next thousand word i use two thing to superpower my noveling the nanowordsprints twitter account which is staffed   by encouraging writer who announce word sprint writing a much a you can in  minute for example because twitter is social this also give you a place to celebrate and or complain a you complete each spring write or die a writing tool that doe bad thing if you stop typing set it to kamikaze mode and it will erase what you ve written a soon a your finger are idle for a few second it s like the bus in speed but for writing freewrite look you re supposed to write   word that are part of this work of fiction but nobody say it ha to be polished prose especially if you re stuck on a plot point or a bit of world building just freewrite that s a technical writerly term for writing down whatever you re thinking if you think about your novel it look something like this okay i don t know what to do from here but matilda ha to get onto the train somehow even though she s lost her ticket maybe she sneak on maybe she find a squirrel that ha been stealing ticket and hiding them in a hole with acorn underneath the platform maybe that weird guy from chapter  come back and offer to buy her a ticket and she s like ew but i don t want to sit next to you and so then i can spend the whole chapter trying to get her away from him once she s on the train yeah that sound good i m hungry i wonder if there are any cooky downstairs that wa over  word and it took mere second to write i don t even know who matilda is you can fill thousand this way especially if you re trying to feel out your character s backstory or some aspect of the fantasy world your character live in when you get to a plot point you d like to write feel free to switch back to real writing mode find a predictable story arc one thing that make writing hard is not knowing what you re going to write next so find something you do know how to write maybe you can send a character to the doctor that mean they have to make an appointment drive over find parking sign in have an awkward conversation in the waiting room and so on you can spice it up however you want they discover the doctor is really the villain they were trying to track down in the previous chapter whatever make sure to have them run errand afterward and pick up their prescription do something unpredictable or maybe your problem is that your plot is already planned out and you are just too bored to write the next thing so mix it up for the next scene you have planned out ask yourself what is the least predictable thing that could happen here maybe your character wa going to get in a bar fight with the tough guy that s making trouble but the tough guy ha to leave early for his job in the morning and your character decides to follow him to see where he work or maybe a they re squaring up to fight there s an earthquake that demolishes the bar even cheaper trick look you do what you have to give your character lengthier name search and replace for example ann can become anna elizabeth who think she is a princess for literally every mention of her name if you just spent an hour on facebook instead of writing gather up all your comment and status and put them in your novel it s your character that s wasting time on facebook not you anna elizabeth who think she is a princess would like to spend a whole chapter telling the reader her political opinion have a two headed character or fine two separate character who get into argument about everything write a lot of appendix have your character on a spaceship write the ship s technical manual murder mystery make an appendix that s a timeline of how thing actually happened and in what order western list the name of all the horse in the town and what color they are do you know how to knit have one character teach another how to knit don t spare any detail don t delete anything ever have a scene that doesn t quite work well you wrote it so it count select it and hit format gt text gt strikethrough or whatever doe that job in the software you re using and keep counting those word your character s favorite recipe and song lyric deserve space in the book don t you think you can do this i believe in you
title: Dirty Tricks to Finish NaNoWriMo Today, Even If You’re Behind

content: are you avoiding your family right now so desperate to escape them that you re sitting in the bathroom reading a productivity blog on thanksgiving dreading the inevitable fight over fox news or your lack of a plus one or which kid hogged the college fund here s your solution get drunk and cause a scene a fight wa going to happen anyway now it ll be on your term you can choose the topic and pre empt the fight you d lose with the fight you d win or you can steer away from politics or religion and toward some personal argument taking one for the team just to avoid sinking everyone into an existential funk if you strike first you ll also get to set the tone and the tactic make thing shouty or whispered through gritted teeth punctuated by sloshing red wine on the hardwood floor bonus point if you re the only drinker in a teetotaler family if you re from one of those family that don t fight but store everything up for year maybe it s time to open the safety valve start a nice safe fight that let everyone work out their feeling in a somewhat controlled environment will thing get out of hand probably but that s what would have happened anyway and now you ve given the family something to rally around blaming you so clear the air now while you still have time to make up before christmas
title: You Should Get Drunk and Cause a Scene Today

content: good morning want to get california today by email here s the sign up self flying car are not here but this past week in tracy calif a tech start up called skyryse began testing a new emergency response service that it see a a small and careful step toward passenger aircraft that can fly on their own due for launch in january the service will shuttle police officer and medical worker across the san joaquin valley via a helicopter equipped with the kind of sensor that power driverless car a radar sensor for instance provides a detailed view of the aircraft s surroundings even in bad weather not unlike the laser sensor used by the autonomous car that are now being tested in place like arizona and texas at the moment these sensor operate alongside seasoned pilot but they will gather enormous amount of flight data that can feed the creation of system that can fly the helicopter on their own in another echo of the work inside the maker of self driving car skyryse engineer are using this data to build simulation of real world flying condition that can help test these system skyryse is just one of many company pushing toward this kind of technology including xwing another northern california start up and uber the ride hailing company that is also building driverless car uber is one of several company working toward a kind of flying taxi service

content: but what are the limit of the attorney general power and doe the office have a core mandate i asked david a carrillo executive director of u c berkeley california constitution center about the job essentially he said it charge is very broad the office ha a wide array of responsibility under two broad category acting a the state lawyer and a it highest law enforcement official mr carrillo said in an email the latter give the attorney general some power over local prosecutor sheriff and police chief while he wouldnt comment on any specific attorney general mr carrillo said that breadth of responsibility mean whoevers in the role set his or her own legal priority during the term in the case of pg amp e bankruptcy for instance the attorney general ha the power to file lawsuit or intervene in existing action including appearing on california behalf in a federal bankruptcy proceeding mr carrillo said if the attorney general belief it necessary they can also take on any criminal investigation refer matter to county prosecutor or convene a grand jury to consider any criminal matter in the event of a conflict of interest the attorney general could employ a special counsel to handle a prosecution finally mr carrillo said the sheer volume of issue the attorney general office deal with mean that while battle with the federal government might be more attention grabbing theyre actually a sliver of the office caseload in fact he said it wa recently estimated that federal case absorb about  percent of the departmental budget nevertheless mr carrillo said it important for state to occasionally push back against the federal government
title: California Today: California Today: The Power of the Attorney General

content: when official will send high priority warning during tsunami blizzard tornado hurricane extreme wind condition storm surge snow squall and flash flood in new york flash flood warning are the most common said nelson vaz a warning coordination meteorologist for the weather service on day like today the weather service s forecaster are constantly monitoring rainfall rate and the affected environment if they feel the rainfall rate are going to exceed the ability of the ground to absorb that rainfall and you re going to see a threat to life and property from flooding that s when the forecaster will issue a flash flood warning mr vaz explained how the warning are issued from the national weather service s office in upton n y using computer software called warngen which allows the forecaster to create the text of the message describing the location and hazard for example and to target the geographic area where the flooding is expected to happen the technology called wireless emergency alert is the same tool that can push out amber alert or emergency warning from the president at   p m on oct  the trump administration is planning to send a test presidential alert

content: so you have a culture change they ve gone from an openly racist and misogynist subculture that they had controlling the majority culture for at least  year over the last  year that is what we have exorcised after the rodney king riot m rice said one of the most important change wa the shift in the demographic makeup of the force when i first started suing l a p d it wa  percent white military men she said it s  percent minority now m rice ha had a close relationship with the departing chief charlie beck who replaced the reformist william j bratton charlie beck took the aggressive reform baton from bratton and he ran a fantastic leg she said because of charlie beck we now have what we call partnership policing they are the only cop in a major city who get promoted not for making arrest but for demonstrating how they kept a kid out of the prison pipeline looking forward she said there wa still a long way to go abuse of force is still something we re trying to get recalibrated so that there isn t hair trigger shooting m rice said so you don t get those video of shooting of unarmed people

content: bird and lime are among the electric scooter start ups leading the craze in los angeles and san francisco but in new york city it s still anyone s market m kaufman said the biggest obstacle here there s no place for scooter physically they re too fast for the sidewalk they re too slow for traffic and they re too slow for bike lane so there isn t a safe space for them m kaufman said most can go up to  mile per hour the focus here is on backless bike and electric assist bike because those are the speed of new york read about the new era of bike share in our city even so exploring travel alternative remains top of mind for some city resident with the l train shutdown le than a year away scooter could offer a great advantage to those affected according to m kaufman who led a rudin center report on way to mitigate commute during the closure of the subway line we re going to have hundred of thousand of people needing to find new mode of transportation she said because there will be overcrowding on other subway line we might a well provide a variety of mode like rideshare and bus bridge and of course bike share however not every person can or is willing to ride a bike scooter have a lower barrier to entry she added you re generally not scooting in traffic you re generally on the sidewalk and it s easier to learn to navigate a scooter and you don t necessarily need a helmet like you do with a bike she said so people see it a an easier mode a faster mode than walking but not a labor intensive or stressful a biking
title: New York Today: New York Today: Are Electric Scooters Legal?

content: there are no straight line on the board so shaping is done all by light and by feel he said he then layer on sheet of fiberglass and a coating of epoxy resin in a room heated to between  and  degree which help keep the syrupy resin malleable finally he sand out any imperfection the process is similar to woodworking said mr schmidt who spent time a a young man working for a carpenter in landlocked richmond va where he s from shaping a board also reminds him of surfing the work is done quietly by yourself he said you re connected to an object and the rhythm in your body and you have time to think and recalibrate it take him about two or three day to make a custom board which he sell for between   and   the best is when people i make board for tell me dude i just had the best session of my life or i caught the longest wave of my life he said i get to create something with my own hand that connects people to the ocean and water it feel great to be able to connect people with nature through the surfing craft
title: New York Today: New York Today: Making Surfboards

content: good morning on this toasty monday the weather s heating up and so are our court two major corruption trial are set to begin this week in new york both featuring defendant who have worked closely with gov andrew m cuomo it s been the season for public corruption trial in the manhattan federal court said the new york time reporter benjamin weiser he noted that these will be the third and fourth major corruption trial in just six month in the same court in march one of the governor s former top aide joseph percoco wa found guilty in a corruption trial and in a widely watched retrial in may sheldon silver the former state assembly speaker wa convicted of corruption for the second time mr silver had long been one of the so called three men in a room in albany who were said to control decision making in the capital mr cuomo wa another here s what you need to know about the upcoming trial one the trial of alain e kaloyeros an ex ally of mr cuomo s and the former president of the state university s polytechnic institute at his peak mr kaloyeros a flamboyant physicist whom the governor once called new york s secret weapon had wide sway over the buffalo billion the governor s signature upstate economic development program
title: New York Today: New York Today: It’s Corruption Trial Season

content: good morning here the sign up if you dont already get california today by email while youre still getting situated in the new year we wanted to take another opportunity to look back at the past  month in california the year wa packed with huge news much of which will affect where the golden state is headed next and im not just talking about tech deadly fire a mass shooting and a continuing metoo reckoning in hollywood all roiled the state in their own way but there were other story too some were hopeful some highlighted community that dont often get their due some were just plain unexpected my editor julie and i asked a few of our correspondent in california to pick a favorite story from the past year and explain why it wa important here what they said adam nagourney this story an urgent debate for california republican how to get back in the game signaled what wa one of the big california story of the year the republican party here in crisis it wa already fading donald trump pushed it to the edge of the map in november thomas fuller there were terrifying story about fire and shooting warning about earthquake and lament about the plight of the most vulnerable when it feel like the world is falling apart everyone need a good walk in the wood i loved this piece on the reopening of the mariposa grove of giant sequoia in yosemite national park after a three year restoration project
title: California Today: California Today: The Best Stories From 2018

entertained with sideshow the poorly organized   mile race wa used by the sport promoter c c pyle to advertise everything from shoe to the new route  for the racer it meant running more than a marathon every day for nearly three month it got so that when i went to bed my leg were still pumping up and down said harry abrams a runner from the lower east side in  my shin swelled up like stovepipe after surviving  day of blazing heat dog bite a car crash and rumor that the promoter couldn t pay out the promised prize money  participant arrived in new york sunburned and weather beaten to a cindery complexion reported the time some trotted some limped some walked a on eggshell during the last leg inside madison square garden mr pyle wa furious at their apathy streak it boy he shouted from the sideline show em what i ve brought to new york the new yorker mr adam finished th and missed out on the    first place prize but the following year he ran the derby again this time from new york to los angeles and earned a citation in ripley s believe it or not for completing back to back cross country trip new york today is a morning roundup that is published weekday at  a m if
