content: cod black ops  is available today marking yet another chapter in the franchise s history the black ops series developed by treyarch tends to be one of call of duty s most popular and black ops  doesn t show any sign of being any different alongside multiplayer black ops  also includes zombie and blackout the new battle royale mode coming to cod black ops  is the first cod installment to not launch with any campaign mode folk who pre ordered the game had an opportunity to play it briefly over the past few month a part of the beta but now the game is out there and available to all one quick thing folk who buy a physical copy of the game will need to free up some space on their console a the game requires a gb update to play zombie multiplayer or go to the specialist headquarters luckily you can start playing blackout a soon a the update is  percent complete in other word if you bought the game and can t wait to play you should pop that sucker in and start the download asap
title: CoD: Black Ops 4 is available today

content: twitter s new prototype application is rolling out to the first group of tester starting today the company announced this afternoon by way of a tweet the app which twitter is calling twttr a a throwback to it original name wa first introduced at the ce conference this january it aim to offer twitter a more experimental testing space where the company can try out new idea outside of it existing public network gain feedback from tester then develop new feature a a result of what it learns initially the new twttr app will focus on testing new design for conversation a the company demonstrated at ce the prototype app will show a different format for reply where conversation themselves have a more rounded chat like shape and are indented so they re easier to follow engagement sharing option and other tweet detail are hidden from view in order to simplify reading through longer thread and most notably the different type of reply are color coded to designate those from the original poster a well a those twitter user you personally follow this is meant to offer better visual cue to reader who are trying to follow a lengthier thread where often side conversation take place or the original poster jump in to clarify thing or respond to individual tweet our prototype app twttr launch to the first group of participant today letshaveaconvo about new feature to build a better twitter together twitter support twittersupport march   over time twitter may use the prototype app to test out other change it want to make to the product for instance the company ha experimented with idea around status update field and icebreaker a your pinned tweet to encourage conversation twitter ha said not everyone will be accepted to the prototype app testing program only a couple of thousand of english and japanese speaker will be invited provided they follow twitter s rule however no one is under nda so tester will be able to discus what they re seeing on twitter itself which open up the idea to more feedback twitter say the first group of tester will receive an email invite sometime over the next few day once received user have to click a link to confirm their participation then await another email invite from apple s testflight they can then download the new twttr app and use it instead of the main twitter app while tweeting about the new look using the hashtag letshaveaconvo tester can also submit feedback through an online form the twttr app wa already spotted in the wild before today s announcement but it hadn t rolled out in large number at that time after all these year twitter is still trying to figure out how to improve conversation on it platform not only are they challenging to follow visually speaking they often devolve into trolling and abuse that s something other change to the product may try to tackle from enhanced reporting procedure to twitter s latest development of a hide tweet button the prototype app isn t immediately looking to solve the problem around online abuse though a a side effect of redesigned conversation thread comment that contribute to instead of detract from an online conversation could be better highlighted twitter say those who haven t yet applied to test the new app can still do so application opened up last month and remain open today already applied check your email for update in the next few day on the waitlist stay tuned well add participant want in you can still apply twitter support twittersupport march
title: Twitter’s new prototype app ‘twttr’ launches today

content: i don t think most staten island people think about tick because it s a relatively new problem said the lead researcher maria diuk wasser an associate professor in columbia s department of ecology evolution and environmental biology we want to educate people about the risk and tell them where they re more at risk the project surveyed the five borough and found the most tick on staten island some in pelham bay park in the bronx and a small number in queen they did not find any in central park and we don t expect them to be there because there are no deer dr diuk wasser said the key is really deer the team sampled a dozen park on staten island and in all of them found tick infected with lyme disease bacteria nymph young tick become infected by feeding on bird and small mammal like mouse chipmunk raccoon and opossum dr diuk wasser explained but it s deer that are responsible for transporting dangerous adult tick farther and wider a tick s happy place is in a humid forested area tree filled leaf littered shrubby area are tick territory sunny dry patch of grass are usually not home at highest risk for tick exposure are often those closer to park those with yard frequented by deer and those with white footed mouse dr diuk wasser said and if a team of tick scientist ring your doorbell this summer don t be alarmed the researcher will be going house to house on staten island through july educating on tick collecting data for the app and offering yard check
title: New York Today: New York Today: Time to Talk Ticks

content: good morning want to get california today by email here s the sign up a heavy flow of central american migrant and refugee ha continued toward the u s mexico border despite intensifying obstacle to entering the united state the trump administration s zero tolerance approach to illegal border crossing the separation of thousand of migrant family and tightening of credible fear qualification on asylum request in interview along the border last week many described harrowing journey from their home country of honduras el salvador and guatemala marching through central american wilderness and borderland on foot hiding in van through mexican immigration checkpoint and even riding on top of cargo train back home they had left behind family member home and farm because threat against their life had made remaining untenable many family told the new york time they would rather be separated from their child then send them back home victor clark alfaro an adjunct professor at san diego state university and director of the binational center for human right in tijuana said that he did not believe the flow of migrant would stop mr clark alfaro said that in his extensive experience on the border working with migrant an abundance of violence back home remained by far the most prevalent reason people have left their country it s the gang violence that is the biggest factor that is forcing them out the economic situation is second the violence is the primary reason he said but the gang violence go right along with the economy there aren t any option
title: California Today: California Today: When Asylum Is Your ‘Only Shot’

content: one hundred and fifty year ago the brooklyn flint glass company wa tugged through new york s waterway to corning n y transforming an upstate town  mile northwest of manhattan into an artistic hub for glassmaking the company became corning glass work to celebrate the anniversary the corning museum of glass ha set up a floating glassmaking studio glassbarge off pier  at brooklyn bridge park it s holding free glassblowing demonstration daily from  a m to  p m through memorial day you can make reservation here educator from the south street seaport museum and lake champlain maritime museum will also be on deck to talk about life along new york s th century canal and how the waterway played a role in and continue to support state commerce and culture read our full write up of the glassbarge tour after it run in brooklyn the barge will travel up the hudson river and along the erie canal homeward bound making nearly  stop before september you can see the full schedule here new york today is a morning roundup that is published weekday at  a m if you don t get it in your inbox already you can sign up to receive it by email here also we are experimenting with a limited run newsletter this summer to offer you the best event food and drink in new york sign up for summer in the city here a a weekly newsletter it s not a commitment and like summer it s fleeting it will only publish through labor day for new york today update throughout the day like u on facebook what would you like to see here to start your day post a comment email u at nytoday nytimes com or reach u via twitter using nytoday follow the new york today columnist alexandra levine and jonathan wolfe on twitter you can find the latest new york today at nytoday com

content: turn out those rumor that beat wouldn t have anything to show off during today s big apple event weren t  percent true granted there wa no mention of the headphone maker during the event itself instead the company sent out a bit of an also ran press release a thing were still unfolding here in cupertino the big reason the brand got no love during today s event these aren t new product really rather they re color update to two of beat existing line in fact the new shade were designed to match apple s new hardware fittingly the headphone are priced to match their corresponding handset the   over ear beat solo  wireless now come in satin gold and satin silver to match the new color for the iphone x x max while the   urbeats earphone are available in yellow blue and coral to match the cheaper iphone xr the latter also sport a lightning cable so you don t have to futz with the dongle which is a fun phrase they also snap together magnetically so they can be worn around the neck the new beat solo  wireless color are shipping now and the urbeats are coming later this fall
title: Beats did announce something today, after all

content: given that the company is just now putting it foot into the podcasting space it might take a bit before the pgp is able to really find user new show they haven t heard of but that s what beta testing is for after all and even if the pgp will need to do some analysis on user listening habit it s still worth noting that the service now serf a a one stop shop for both music and podcasts that s something spotify and google have offered for a while now but until now pandora ha only offered a few podcasts albeit some very high profile show but now the company ha a podcast library made up of content from top publisher including gimlet maximum fun npr prx pri the new york time the ringer and wnyc studio with more to come having both music and podcasts in a single app should help pandora keep it user engaged rather than jumping to another service if you want to start seeing how good pandora s recommendation engine is both paid and free user can sign up on pandora s website to get into the beta the company say that people who ve signed up will get access in the following week
title: Pandora's podcast recommendation engine launches in beta today

content: good morning want to get california today by email here s the sign up the salina valley is known a the salad bowl of the world so it s no surprise that there are a lot of pesticide used in california farm country we recently paid a visit to the chamacos project run by the university of california berkeley which for nearly two decade ha been studying the effect of pesticide on the child of salina area farm worker chamacos is spanish for child this wa the backdrop we chose for a story on the trump administration s war on what it call secret science at the environmental protection agency at the urging of agrochemical company the administration ha proposed forcing study like the chamacos project to make public information about it study participant in order to continue to be considered by regulator former e p a official and academic view the move a a breach of privacy safeguard and said the proposal echoed what the tobacco industry once tried to do in thwarting science that highlighted the danger of smoking the industry which keep much of it own research secret say it is a legitimate effort to improve transparency study like chamacos part of a field known a epidemiology examine disease trend in people they are often complex because they require adjusting for the many different chemical and pollutant people are exposed to it wa only under the obama administration that the e p a began to more seriously incorporate epidemiology alongside lab test of how pesticide impact rat and other animal
title: California Today: California Today: ‘Secret Science’ in the Salinas Valley?

content: good morning want to get california today by email here s the sign up over the year each mass shooting in america renews a stalled debate about gun control but in those conversation far le attention is paid to ammunition without bullet however a gun is a useless piece of metal and so a growing number of gun control advocate are arguing that tightening rule on the sale or purchase of ammunition is potentially a useful way to lessen gun violence california already enforces some of the most restrictive gun law in the country and it is now leading the drive for more limit on ammunition gun control advocate in the state have pushed to limit internet sale ban large capacity magazine require seller to have license raise tax on bullet and mandate serial number or other traceable marking so the police can more easily track them the idea of regulating gun by tightening control on bullet is not new and ha been floated over the year by a diverse mix of public figure including senator daniel patrick moynihan and the comedian chris rock but gun right advocate who see such regulation a an end run around the second amendment say these measure are expensive ineffective and put an undue burden on lawful gun user including hunter range regular and sport shooter over the next several month we will explore the regulation and commerce of ammunition with a mix of story focused on topic like how law enforcement us shell casing to solve crime why million of american make or reload their ammunition at home and how hunter concerned about poisoning scavenger are leading the effort to shift toward non lead bullet we began this week with a look at california and it position on gun and ammunition and how the state ha emerged a the battleground for this conversation and debate
title: California Today: California Today: Limiting Ammunition to Thwart Gun Violence

content: good morning want to get california today by email here s the sign up the defiant one have come to california of course they have where else would they go mayor governor corporate executive and environmental activist from four continent are gathering in san francisco this week to show what they can do to stave off the most catastrophic effect of climate change even if the president of the world s most powerful country the united state which is also history s biggest polluter won t it s a gamble a my colleague brad plumer writes these defiant one are trying to demonstrate that they can take big step to cut the greenhouse gas emission that have warmed the atmosphere since the beginning of the industrial age but their effort have not been enough to offset the effect of the trump administration s rollback on climate policy and the world a a whole is nowhere close to meeting the target set under the paris climate accord three year ago an accord that president trump intends to withdraw the united state from california is not just where some of the consequence of climate change are being felt acutely nor simply a place where high profile solution are being tested out it ha also been a finger in the eye of the trump administration on climate policy for instance it ha challenged his rollback on fuel efficiency standard
title: California Today: California Today: Tackling Climate Change, Without Trump

content: there a growing anxiety of how we measure economic prosperity and california is a poster child for why thats a legitimate debate service economy low wage worker working full time without worker comp benefit uninsured thats where we are struggling we have these high wage high skill job and then you have a third of the population im loosely defining a third not for politifact purpose that are working full time and are around the poverty rate q gay marriage is the issue you are most identified with do you consider that your singular achievement a it a point of pride to have been associated with that movement everyone wa running that wa lonely but it shape my frustration with my own party my willingness to be independent of my own party the fact that i survived that i wasnt sure i wa going to q do you see yourself like governor brown a being a national figure for democrat a to the extent you have this extraordinary bully pulpit because california punch above it weight so it matter what governor brown say it always mattered what governor said in the past you can move market the obvious proof point is the automobile industry

barnes the team s youngest member had not been born when the american woman last took home gold in  during her lifetime the united state lost to canada three time in gold medal game and indeed she is not your typical defender she stand barely more than five foot tall but she s quick skillful and a perfect fit in the american new system which requires player with many of her strength m barnes wa a late addition to the  olympic squad she ha said she wa surprised to have even made this team and a previous time article speculated that because she wa not well known to canada she could give the team a pivotal edge a it turned out thursday s contest could hardly have been closer it required a shootout which also went into overtime to decide but after the win with a gold medal hanging from her neck m barnes reportedly said there wa never a doubt california today go live at  a m pacific time weekday tell u what you want to see catoday nytimes com california today is edited by julie bloom who grew content: since the top  percent of californian own a lot of stock a stock market decline that result in lower capital gain could have a disproportionately large impact on california and it state budget dr vissing jorgensen said we have a lot of tech company in california and their stock tend to feel the impact of market movement more acutely tech company like say apple tend to sell product known a consumer durables product like an iphone that do not have to be bought frequently because they last for a long time when people are feeling strapped they tend to cut back on buying those type of product those company tend to be high beta dr vissing jorgensen said meaning that tech stock move more than one for one with the stock market company like apple she said have a beta above one meaning that a  percent drop in the market tends to be associated with a larger than  percent drop in their stock price the industry composition of our business matter because some industry like tech are more affected by the underlying economic driver of the stock market decline dr vissing jorgensen said the big picture all that said dr vissing jorgensen urged people to keep thing in perspective the stock market ha declined but it s a pretty modest decline compared to how much the run up ha been she said it s now basically flat for this year but it still went up a huge amount last year content: faststart work by applying machine learning to identify which part of the game are required for full fledged gameplay this is what differentiates it from the ready to start feature it will allow you to launch a game about twice a fast a you were able to before if the game ha faststart enabled all you have to do is start downloading it your console will automatically take care of the rest the catch is that the feature is only available right now on certain english language title in the game pas catalog however the faststart feature will be expanding to additional game in multiple language soon you will be able to see a full list of supported title here though it hadn t been updated at the time this article wa being written the july update also brings a new way to organize your apps and game with group additionally the update provides more robust search option pressing the y button while you re on the dashboard will bring up the search menu you can take a close look at these improvement and more in the full release

content: but first i needed coffee the closest place i found wa kavasutra in the east village a  minute subway ride away the subway doe not accept bitcoin so to ride i had to cheat after pulling a shot of cold brew for   btc or  the barista called up a qr code on an ipad i scanned it with an app on my phone but it didn t work he began coaching me like a child patiently setting up grandpa s facebook account and then gave up but eventually i figured it out the payment went through and i became his third bitcoin paying customer of the day paying with cryptocurrency wa like that exciting fraught and never the same twice i wa invoiced by email for a load of laundry at the eco laundry company in chelsea i texted with a hair stylist in israel who accepted a tip on behalf of his colleague at armando pia hair salon on the upper east side i waited finger crossed for five minute before a payment finally posted and i could dig into an ice cream sandwich at melt bakery on the lower east side and like an obsessive day trader i would check my digital wallet and watch a the value went up and down by a few cent every few minute it wa fun until i got hungry i had searched for restaurant and grocery store using coinmap the blockchain wallet and filter on yelp but almost none took bitcoin and most said they never had no one is really using it the way it s supposed to be used a a currency said dan sim who accepts bitcoin at his lean crust pizza shop in fort greene brooklyn circa  he said he d process dozen of bitcoin purchase a week but a the currency became more valuable and volatile that s dropped to zero people don t want to part with their bitcoin he said i couldn t find anyone to sell me le than   worth of sock or a gym that accepted bitcoin by the time lunch rolled content: the progress report released last week is based on a series of housing goal that are decided by a regional body of government over the eight year period covered by the goal beverly hill wa required to build a total of three housing unit one very low income housing unit one low income housing unit and one moderately priced housing unit in fairness the wealthy los angeles county city far exceeded it number at least on a percentage basis by issuing permit for a total of nine low and moderate income housing unit the city wa not required to build any high income housing unit since it already ha a lot of them nevertheless it blew it goal of zero out of the water and issued  new permit for high income housing scott wiener the san francisco senator who wrote the streamlining bill on which the recent report wa based said in an interview that number like those reported by beverly hill are why he is working on a new bill that would try to neutralize the role of politics in housing production by tying future state housing goal to economic measure like job growth it would also carry forward past housing deficit so that city that don t build will lose further control over local housing decision a time go on it s absurd and we see this around the state where community that are whiter and more affluent are able to push down their number and essentially opt out of new housing he said california online please note we regularly highlight article on news site that have limited access for nonsubscribers photo with smartphones they ve got you for every waking moment said roger mcnamee an early investor in facebook and a member of the new center for humane technology credit karsten moran for the new york time a group of silicon valley technologist who were early employee at facebook and google alarmed over the ill effect of social network and smartphones are banding together to challenge the company they helped build the new york time yes both of california s senator are woman but in an election year rocked by sexual harassment scandal and the emergence of the metoo movement woman in california politics are still running at the margin the phenomenon is especially striking in this heavily democratic state where no woman ha ever held the governorship and woman account for only  of the  state legislator politico one reason progressive supervisor gave for content: after day of press conference teasing game arriving in some time within the next decade here s a refreshing bit of news a previously rumored wildly popular sandbox survival game fortnite is indeed coming to nintendo switch not only that it s available starting today a a free download from the nintendo eshop epic s title will be available at am pt today a little under an hour from now bringing the battle royale mode that ha made it such a massive money maker on the pc console and io which arrived in march an android version of the title is also in the work for later this summer the game is a perfect fit for console nintendo s long time focus on all age entertainment certainly line up with the title which skews younger than many of the title on display at the show this week along with the perhaps litigiously similar player unknown battleground pubg
title: Fortnite arrives on the Nintendo Switch today

content: her husband asked her to stay away from the lot where homeless men were known to gather her neighbor called her crazy but i wa eager she said and i insisted on being part of the process photo petal out of the soil the site wa recently renamed jenny s garden after m benitez i m seeing the garden that i wa dreaming of m benitez said m benitez rested on a bench that wa donated in the name of her late husband and flipped through early photo of the garden black and white shot revealed abandoned car waist high weed and a group of young men cleaning graffiti off stone wall a the photo transitioned to color the garden took shape with family planting vegetable playing and eating in the garden over the year jenny s garden ha sent hundred of pound of vegetable to a nearby homeless shelter and ha been tended by neighbor schoolchildren resident of a nearby halfway house and orange suited lawbreaker working off their community service we re very proud of what she wa able to do victoria said of her mother the garden ha given the benitez family food a place to play and space to mourn m benitez planted tree there after the death of her husband and two son it made u feel like content: i still have a drought hangover so i wake up worried about drought said felicia marcus the head of the state water resource control board southern california is dealing with the same collection of force that accounted for the intensity of the wine country fire an unusually wet winter led to extensive brush growth and a record hot october baked the growth into kindling the final ingredient wa the heavy santa ana wind whipping across southern california it wa sort of a trifecta for napa and sonoma m marcus said and now you are seeing that recreated in southern california california online please note we regularly highlight article on news site that have limited access for nonsubscribers fire coverage from across the state a new normal for california this year s dreadful fire season may be just the beginning say the editorial board of the san francisco chronicle san francisco chronicle the wine country fire two month ago wa plagued by problem a the authority charge against it star jeffrey tambor new york time and finally the new york time asked reader to share with california today their experience fleeing the fire in los angeles and ventura here lightly edited are some of the response my husband and i along with our  month old fled our house wednesday morning on casiano drive a we left ember were falling from the sky and helicopter were flying low overhead spraying water a completely surreal experience we just bought our house in april it s our dream home and a i type this a house right next door to our neighbor s is in flame i m not sure if our house will make it but thankfully we are all safe lisa goh i got the emergency alert on my phone of fire at  something in the morning i saw an alert of a six acre fire near mulholland drive east of the  that s just a couple of mile away by   the fire had reached  acre and i wa already packing bag and calling my husband who is on business in boston by   i knew for sure we had to get out of there i told our two nanny to wake up immediately and get their bag packed a well a the kid bag packed i told them to pack a if we would never see this house again gwen gottlieb after dinner in westlake we were driving home down the grade and saw the red glow of the fire it wa awful and we just prayed for all in it path thirty minute later we arrived in ventura and the streetlight flickered then the entire city went dark at that point we figured it wa from the fire and headed inside not  minute later i looked out my bedroom window and saw the red glow extremely close i told my daughter we need to start gathering item a it must be spreading within minute i saw the fire crest our hill and it wa panic we literally had minute to get anything we could grab along with our pet including our one week old kitten and a nursing mom and leave we headed to oxnard shore to my fianc s parent home at that point the entire mountain range of ventura wa ablaze stephanie jensen want to submit a content: how do you avoid burnout i don t know i m very tired laugh but we re all very tired i think that the demand of reporter now are very different the only way to avoid burnout is to take cue from your body and your brain if you re making mistake in your copy take a few extra minute and look it over a few extra time double check yourself that doesn t really deal with the feeling of i can t keep doing this but if you need to take a break take a break what s something that newcomer to the industry might not understand about your job there s a difference between letting your source take advantage of you and having good source what are the most important quality in a journalist today not being afraid a lot of time people are afraid of writing something because someone will get mad or they ll lose access that can never be a concern ever that wa true  year ago and even more so now because the culture of bullying reporter ha become more intense here s what else is happening weather techcrunch startup battlefield dubai hosted by area  take place in april  and the deadline to apply is january th  at  pm pst that s just  day away so get a move on startup battlefield dubai will feature early stage startup focused only on the following three category governance logistics and distribution five startup representing each category will be invited to compete onstage in dubai the finalist will receive notification by february th  at pm pst the  startup chosen to compete will receive expert pitch off coaching from techcrunch editor each team will emerge from their training ready to pitch their company in six minute to a panel of judge and field their question for up to six minute the judge will bring their expertise a seasoned entrepreneur investor and technologist to pose some tough question a techcrunch editor will moderate the judge will select five finalist to pitch a second time to win the first ever startup battlefield dubai winner the overall winner will be crowned the first techcrunch startup battlefield dubai champion bring home the u    cash prize techcrunch take no equity of fee the winner will also receive an all expense paid trip for two to san francisco for disrupt sf  techcrunch s flagship event and will compete in that battlefield assuming the company still qualifies at the time startup battlefield dubai will produce one winner for each content: testing out an early version of oculus tv for a few hour revealed an experience that s very similar to other vr video apps you re sat in a living room esque environment with not much going around you except a virtual landscape which lead to a pleasant distraction free feel the main event happens right in front of you in what oculus describes a the equivalent of an  inch tv though i can t be sure it measure exactly  virtual inch it certainly look massive the large viewing area make watching video in bed a much more pleasurable experience than just staring at my phone video looked crisp and colorful a well still i can t help but think watching tv in vr is very much a niche proposition at least for the time being your virtual tv s resolution will never match that of your phone at least not for a few year yet wearing a headset for hour on end might not be everyone s cup of tea either oculus tv doe promise a social feature that let you watch show with your friend much like the netflix app which doe elevate it above the normal video viewing experience but that s dependent on your friend having vr headset too oculus tv might be better with some content more than others perhaps sport event or nature documentary where having that immersive experience make more sense when you launch oculus tv you ll see a selection of curated show featured in a carousel up top with a row of video channel listed underneath select a show and if you don t have the associated app already there ll be an option to download it so for example if you select ball in the family and you don t already have facebook s video app you ll have to hit the install button to get it it s also worth noting that if you do want to get facebook video you ll have to link your oculus and facebook account together that s because aside from watching facebook watch original the app also let you watch your very own uploaded video clip a well a the one shared by your friend and family those aside red bull tv mostly feature extreme sport like skydiving and kiteboarding while pluto tv is more of a cord cutting alternative with curated channel like food tv and more mainstream option like nbc news other option include neverthink which feature the latest internet meme and newsy which show the up to the minute news headline oculus plan on adding even more vr video content soon especially from favorite like espn now that oculus tv is official all go headset will have it installed by default and if you have an oculus headset already you can go ahead and download it right now from the oculus store
title: Oculus TV arrives today with a promising, though questionable, start

content: today april th at   pt techcrunch is bringing you indiebio s demo day indiebio is a four month accelerator focusing on biotech company early stage company are given mentorship   access to biosafety level  and  lab on site insight from industry expert and    in funding the  batch of  company range from innovation in non opioid pain management medication to synthetic wood generation and even using ai to limit antibiotic resistance watch them demo here antibiotic adjuvant delivering ai powered decision support software designed to monitor and reduce antibiotic resistance beeflow developing smart and strong bee for crop pollination with their technology farmer can increase crop yield up to  percent target specific crop for pollination and substantially reduce bee population decline dahlia bioscience leading the next generation of multiplexed in situ single cell rna analysis tool for research and diagnostic application jointech lab pioneering access to high quality fat graft fat derived stem cell and cell therapy their device enables doctor clinic and hospital to provide safe and cost effective non surgical treatment for patient lingrove creating wood without the tree their formable natural fiber and resin replicates the performance look feel and re usability of premium wood from scalable carbon negative material mezomax mezomax enables faster bone fracture healing improved osteoporosis treatment and stronger bone in elderly patient with their novel calcium gluconate stereoisomer which regulates calcium and mineral metabolism neurocarrus developing long acting non opioid chronic pain medication it novel delivery system eliminates addiction potential and side effect that are seen across all opioids nivien therapeutic nivien therapeutic is developing the first small molecule drug to enhance both chemo and immunotherapy their compound overcome multiple resistance mechanism across  cancer to increase efficacy and decrease toxicity of treatment nuro nuro enables instant communication and computing for million of incapacitated patient in post surgery and icu nursing home and rehabilitation by using brain signal onconetics pharmaceutical onconetics pharmaceutical develops gene therapy that target tumor cell with specific gene expression profile the effector arm of the therapy involves a genetic switch that activates an apoptotic inducer to kill the cancer cell and spare healthy tissue srnalytics srnalytics ha developed a novel bioinformatics platform to identify error free small rna biomarkers their proof of concept work in huntington s disease validated eight biomarkers that are  percent accurate for classifying early versus late stage disease and disease progression sun genomics sun genomics is a microbiome health company focused on curing dysbiosis through personalized probiotic their platform enables the highest resolution profiling of customer gut makeup empowering them to make and track change over time terramino food terramino food is reimagining seafood using fungi and algae to make healthy affordable and toxin free product vetherapy vetherapy creates novel stem cell therapy for cat dog and horse their most innovative product speed up wound healing and treat autoimmune and inflammatory disease
title: Watch IndieBio Accelerator’s Demo Day today

content: there wa plenty of talk about android p at today s big i o kickoff but when can you actually download the thing right now a a matter of fact if you ve got one of a handful of compatible handset you can find the upgrade here if you dare the list includes the pixel naturally but the company s also partnering with a whole bunch of third party developer to allow a lot more user to try an early build of the mobile operating system the list includes handset from nokia vivo oneplus xiaomi sony essential and oppo it s a pretty broad spectrum of handset though there are some key absence here including notably samsung htc lg and huawei the new version of the operating system includes a number of visual upgrade a change over the oreo s addition which were largely in the backend there are also some key new gesture based function putting android more inline with recent update to io for the iphone x and the new adaptive battery feature which get more juice out of existing hardware by throttling power on under used apps
title: Android P Beta is available today

music of mexico public radio international infinity mirror museum of ice cream kerry james marshall are instagram post a boon or a benefit for modern art los angeles magazine and finally peter burnett wa the first governor of the state of california ascending to the post on december   but his ignominious legacy is hardly known today mr burnett came from missouri via oregon settling near sacramento amid the gold rush just a he had done in oregon mr burnett pushed to exclude black from the state while he seemed to couch his argument in antislavery term he wa merely disguising his equal opportunity racism said william deverell a historian and the director of the huntington u s c institute on california and the west he wa not particularly unusual at all at the time mr deverell said that s when the really vicious attack on native american started coming and gave way to genocidal violence he wa early opponent of the chinese which lead to the exclusion act he really show you can be antislavery and a racist to the core without any difficulty whatsoever though he is included in fourth grade state history mr burnett s name ha largely been erased from the public sphere his name wa on a san francisco preschool a well a an elementary school in long beach but wa recently taken down and replaced at both school after report of his view and statement resurfaced he talked in this undeniably ugly way about people so we should talk about how we ve honored him mr deverell said these are not issue that are reserved for other part of the united state without resonance in california berkeley continue reading the main story

content: in a recent study issi romem chief economist at buildzoom a san francisco company that help people find contractor looked at the growth of american city over the past several decade and found that city that add a lot of housing do so by expanding outward building suburb and exurbs that are almost exclusively covered by single family home once city stop spreading out their rate of new housing production slows and price shoot upward a the population grows mr romem said there are three choice for how to accommodate more people one is the houston method keep growing outward the second is the bay area method slow down sprawl while leaving existing neighborhood alone raising price and pushing lower earning household out of state in other word slow growth by forcing people to move to houston the third is what no u s city ha yet accomplished grow upward and in place this route is certainly possible but a my story on berkeley show it requires a wholesale rethinking of how city look content: some people see spacex s tactic a risky because they test new rocket feature on active mission rather than performing test launch an obvious example spacex didn t use a test mission to figure out whether a reused falcon  stage could fly they flew that historic mission with an active customer payload though they did charge a lower rate because of the risk involved indeed many of the change to the block  have been have been deployed and refined aboard block  and block  rocket but now there will be little if any tweaking to the rocket during active mission this will make it easier to certify the falcon  rocket for human flight nasa will require seven successful flight of the block  falcon  before it s human rated presumably that mean the design ha to remain the same from flight to flight without too many change right now the gao estimate that human certification for the block  falcon  won t occur until late  most of the change to this final form of the falcon  are designed to emphasize reusability for spacex to become cost effective a it ha aimed to do since the company wa first founded it ha to make a many component on it rocket a reusable a possible this doesn t just mean the first stage of rocket it mean everything from the payload adapter to the grid fin should be reusable not once but multiple time with minimal maintenance and turnaround time from one use to the next according to a round up of change posted on reddit change to the block  falcon  include improved heat shielding around the engine to protect them from the stress of reentry and switched to a thermal protection barrier rather than just paint to help with reusability spacex will also be using titanium grid fin which deploy during and help control reentry rather than aluminum in theory they should be reusable an unlimited number of time the payload fairing ha also been upgraded which will theoretically help with recovery which spacex hasn t been able to do yet many of these tweak are also focused on turnaround time for these rocket having a reusable rocket isn t super cost effective if it take month to perform the maintenance needed before it can be used again spacex is clearly trying to cut down the amount of time between when a rocket is first launched and when it first stage and second stage down the line can be launched again you can watch the live stream of the bangabandhu satellite  launch below the window open today at   pm et and close at   pm et the weather is  favorable if spacex isn t able to launch the block  falcon  a backup launch window open tomorrow at   pm
